Further, it's a place to escape to watch the Giants win (or lose...) when your roommates are too busy playing RockBand, and lastly, it's a place to come to on Tuesdays for that beloved, zany Tuesday Trivia night that we all so fondly cherish and hold deeply in our hearts, or more appropriately, our drowned and seeping livers.

Cheers to the Bitter End.
author: Caitlin M.

description:
03.17.10

St. Patrick's Day Pub Crawl - stop two.

I think they get overwhelmed when they have too many customers, so they don't know who to serve first.  Took a while to get our first drink, but after that they seem to just keep coming.  I guess that's a plus for just standing at the bar!

The pub crawl crowd grew a few members from this stop, too.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Not many weekends are spent drinking shots of WhistlePig whiskey and discussing a break-in at our SF rental home. 
But that is exactly how we spent the last weekend. 
Me, Ky-Yo and Johnny Smoove sat at a booth, debating the crime that had taken place the previous night. 
Some bloke with a key to our front door brought a midget hooker into the house. 
I know, that sounds so UN-PC especially in San Francisco city. 
It was Johnny who saw the two of them, the bloke and the midget hooker, although he keeps saying she was no midget at all! Says she was an Angry Dwarf.
All I know is what I heard. Some people went stompin up and down them stairs in the middle of the night. When I go out to see what the hell is going on, the front door slams shut and I hear laughter and a motorcycle, a custom Harley, speeding away. 
It's him, I thought to meself, it's eL Capitan and now he is gone.
That was that and it was back to bed with the likes of me.
Seemed like only a very, very short time later that 
morning broke open and my head felt a splitting pain. 
The kind of pain that requires the hair of the dog that bit ya. 
So we made the short walk back over to the Bitter End for some pain relief and breakfast.

FOOD! This place serves some damn good pub food (Damn good, anyway, after a night of drunken debauchery).

BEER! And not just cheap domestic drafts this place serves up a warm pint of Guinness which should be a requirement of establishments such as this. And New Castle Brown Ale (loves me some Newkie Brown!) I think they serve about twenty other brews but trust me when I tell you that Guinness and Newkie Brown are the two to order!

WHISKEY! The 'water of life' in the Gaelic language and for all my fellow Irish/Welsh/Americans out there, I have to tell you that Whistle Pig straight rye whiskey is 100% rye and 100 proof (in other words, it's our version of water).
In the midst of discussing the midget hooker mystery, Ky-Yo steps out with a lovely young local woman that he just met, says she gently kisses or did he tell me that her name is Jen LeeKisses? 
Should I mention that the bloke with the petite girl AKA midget hooker was eL Capitan himself?
Should we order another round?
Should we stay? 
Should we leave? 
If I say nothing, will them two ever solve the midget hooker mystery?
Well, the Bitter End is a sports bar and since Johnny and me have wagered on the upcoming game, we need to stay.
Unfortunately for Ky-Yo he forgot that he gave his credit card to the barkeep to pay for our tab.
Well now Johnny and me have just discovered yet another reason to stay!

If you're in the neighborhood, looking for an Irish pub with pool tables, great whiskey (and they even host a trivia night),  stop by and enjoy it 'til the Bitter End!
author: Dave S.

description:
Trivia Night for the win.

Anchor Steam for $3, plus lots of good stuff on tap and a friendly bartender.  Bar food aplenty (greasy, filling stuff--onion rings, chicken fingers, etc), for decent prices.  And, on Tuesdays (or at least the one I went on), the place is packed with a bevy of trivia-ready twenty-somethings.  It's not a heavily patrolled trivia night, so you probably could get away with cheating, but from what I could tell most people respected the spirit of the game.  And as far as trivia, definitely the right combination of hodge-podge, eccentric, and karaoke, and an energetic game-show-esque host.  I'd go again!
author: Naveen A.

description:
Pretty empty on a Saturday night.  We were desperate for food and didn't feel like Asian food but happened to be on this street so decided on this place based on Yelp reviews.  Ehgh, let me tell you, the food at Sizzlers or Norms is better than this place.  Got the NY steak which was tough with lots of tendon or what not in there.  The fried mushrooms were decent but oily.  

Oh, and they didn't honor their sign on the window regarding happy hour til 8pm daily, we were there at 7pm and they said it was over??

As a dive bar, there are better in SF.
author: b t.

description: They were super nice there. The Kitchen was closed (closes at 9). We were hungered, but felt anchored and a bunch of folks had beers that were going to keep us seated there. They encouraged us to bring food in and even gave us plates. I had a Boddington's beer. They played good music. It was lively, but wasn't too loud or crowded -- our group easily got a table. Very cool. Need to go for trivia one of these Tuesdays!
author: Andrew K.

description:
Love this place. Any time we're in that neighborhood, we swing by this place. Sometimes play pool, sometimes shoot darts, jukebox, liquor. It's got anything you'd need in a pub/bar.

 Came here on my buddy's 21st and the bartender was hooking it up with $10 Guinness pitchers after we tipped him $5 on the third one.

Plus when 540 Club finishes dollar drinks (10pm-12am; worth checking out) at midnight, people always end up here.
author: J R.

description:
Good local bar that i would hit up if it was in my 'hood.  Nice Bartendresses, and relatively cheep beers.  The bathroom was really gross, and could use a remodel.  Also, shutting down food service before 10 is unwise on weekends.  

sports on the tv's, but not so obnoxious that you cannot hold a conversation.
author: Pablo E.

description:
I have found the answer to the mid-week blues, and it is a epic game of KNOWLEDGE!  When my team first entered the fray of Tuesday Night Trivia at The Bitter End the latest quiz master was hanging up the boots.  A new reign has been started with Oliver, and he is outstanding.  Questions like "Jew or not a Jew?" "That year in history" and the "Name that Tune" round get our team excited.  

Cash money for Win, Place or Show however the real prize is a round of shots for the best team name.  Come with your wits, because that's what our team guns for.  

Bartender Pascal is awesome, as well as the waitresses.  Their swiftness only adds to the good karma that The Bitter End provides.

Only slight downfall is that it gets packed for TNT, so you have to get there a little early.  However, more the merrier - especially for Tuesday Night Trivia.
author: Chris C.

description: Love this place. Casual. You feel like you're stepping into a place that you've gone your whole life. Cool local hang out where you don't feel like an outsider. Good menu- they also serve lunch and bunch on weekends....
author: Andrew A.

description:
Short and sweet, this place is 5 STARS!!!

This is a roomy pub...nice so that you're not treated a thorough groping the moment you walk in the door!! (later maybe, where's my Guinness first!?!?!?)   However, whenever I've gone it's been packed to the gills so the forecast for immediate groping danger is HIGH!! (~_~)   Maybe I secretly like this...but I always find myself there on Weekend nights, Pub Quiz Nites (Tuesdays)  St. Patricks' Day....but go at other times and you have room to roam, play pool, play some darts, enjoy a Guinness,  twirl, chow on some very decent pub grub (would rate their fries/burgers 4.5 STARS!!!  Yummy shepherd's pies and sausage rolls....haven't tried much else but I've spied some of the other offerings and they look pretty scrum too!

The crowd is sometimes full of USF'r's...but more often than not it's a nice blend of ages/workin' lads/lasses, ethnicities....and everyone hootin' and having a great time!!!
author: Karen S.

description:
I only went here once, and this is the only location I tried that doesn't use Brainstormer Trivia. It was fun, but loud and with too many people. There was a limerick round which was fun and different, and a music round where you had to name the song and the artist (as opposed to just the artist). The regulars really took to some bar song that everyone sung at a certain point during the game. Not being a regular I was sort of out of it, but it looked like fun if you were in the know and knew the words.

Out of 5 Stars
Trivia Fun: 4 
Trivia Prize: 4
Odds of Winning: 2
author: Kathleen M.

description:
This bar is the bread and butter of the Inner Richmond. It is a host to an energetic, polite, and upbeat crowd which i am pleased to be a part of. 

The bar seems to maintain steady business throughout the week. If you are looking to introduce out-of-town guests, or new friends to a sweet bar, reel them in by taking them to Trivia Night on Tuesdays.

[  + ]

Love the crowd, everyone is great. Women are beautiful, sophisticated, and mellow; Men are polite, and not assholes, haven't seen a fight in this bar yet.

Bartenders treat all patrons like regulars, lovely older women and a few guys who are equally as rad.

Bar food is legit.

Prices are awesome.

[ - ]

um... i guess they could optimize business by putting a mini-bar upstairs and a few more tables. Other than that, The Bitter End is quite sweet.
author: Peter T.

description:
PROs:
+ Great bartenders.
+ Good beer selection.
+ Pool tables!
+ 4 ciders on tap (for those of you that enjoy that sort of thing).

CONs:
- Very few...
author: Dalton C.

description:
Happy hour with the work crew led us to a near by watering hole.  I was surprised that a rum and coke was $6 but I guess i didn't check out the drink specials.  But, the drink was stiff and because I drank prior to eating I ended up a little buzzed by the time we ordered some food.  Onion rings are excellent, and I'm not just saying that.  I RARELY eat them and I must have hogged the whole basket.  The curry fries are also excellent BUT you must get the curry on the side.  The fries were soggy before they even reached our table.  We ordered our 2nd basket of curry fries "correctly" after polishing off the first.  The calamari was OK, nothing special.  I have to say the food was the shining star that night.  

They also have a fun trivia night but the place is usually packed with a bunch of regulars.  I've been there twice for this and both times felt like I was missing some kind of inside joke you would only get after you become a regular.  I'm not hating!!! :P

Oh, and FYI, the woman's restroom is upstairs.  And as you walk around the corner they have full length mirror you might run right into.
author: Rosalind S.

description:
A few months settled into my brand new San Francisco life, I started wondering if Pub Quizzing was strictly an East Coast phenomenon... until I ventured out last week to The Bitter End's Tuesday Trivia!

The bar was pretty packed... but although we arrived at 9 on the dot, we were still able to snag a few seats towards the far end of the bar. The bartender was pretty busy of course, but still very nice about keeping our pitchers filled, and letting us open small individual tabs too. (Insider tip: He also helped us answer one or two of the trivia questions!)

As for the quiz itself, very fun and entertaining. The MC was hilarious and the questions ran the gamut from challenging to "freebie"... everyone got to feel smart for at least 30 seconds.

In short: definitely recommend this place to get your weekly Quizzo fix! A good time was had by all, and we will be returning soon. Maybe even with a better team name next time!
author: Lauren K.

description:
I never liked beer or shots, but I do love fruity girly girl drinks. Not here though, I found something even better. I do love flavored cider. Pear, peach, and my recent discovery here, raspberry! Tart and tangy, just how I love my fro-yo. Yum! It does leave your mouth with a tarty after taste though, nothing a little food can't cure. 

Just your typical dive bar. Plenty of tables and seating. Food is served here as well. I really have to come back and see what all this Trivia talk is about. 

P.S. You can play pool upstairs.The bathroom is upstairs too, no bueno for a girl in heels + bar!
author: Tracy T.

description: My friend plays trivia here Tuesday nights. I've been a few times and it's always entertaining. Identifying celebrities when they were younger, name that iPod song, and obscure trivia. Watching a giants game at the same time with intense fans was heavenly. I've also had a turkey burger here and it was reasonably priced and delicious. I am a fan. Not sure why it doesn't get 5 stars. Maybe if they gave foot massages.
author: Marty J.

description: Pretty good place to go.  Good selection of beers on tap and generally not too crowded.
author: Kyle M.

description: Best bar in the neighborhood. I've been a regular for 10+ years and love the friendly staff, super long happy hour, and the food is even good and reasonably priced.
author: Evel K.

description: I was pleasantly surprised by this place. I'm used to the hustle and bustle that is Russian Hill (aka: Mini Marina) and thought there would be no way I'd have fun at bitter end. After a great meal at Burma Superstar we hit this place up and it was dead. I loved it! We played darts and pool all night as we threw back some beers. If I happen to be out on Clement again I'll definitely go back.
author: Carlos A.

description:
Love this bar. Went on my birthday in March for trivia night. My team was atrocious, but good times were had! 

Last I checked their website was in desperate need of revision. I keep contemplating offering my services, but I'm not a professional.
author: Alex C.

description:
Normally, I was a big fan of the bitter end. A great hangout to catch up with the homies over some cheap pitchers of PBR. 

Lesson learned, never use your card here. The bartender, Martina, said she would let me buy a pitcher for $10 on my card even though the minimum is $20. Great!

Then I check my account a few days later. $21. She charged herself a nice $10 tip in order to make it go up to the $20 limit. Then you attempt to call them and nothing. 

If this was a one time deal, I'd be disappointed. But granted that last St. Paddy's day they also lost my card and charged me after they said the next round would be on them. 

Bitter end: great place if you're using cash. Apparently dishonest place if you use your credit card.
author: Max W.

description: We ordered 1 beer plus 2 diet cokes. We were served 2 very flat regular cokes. When we went back to the bar and asked to exchange for iced teas, the bartender acted like a total as..... - I mean, jerk - and insisted they were  diet cokes and tbat they were not flat and would not change or repour them.
author: N. S.

description: The Bitter End is a misnomer because it's typically the place where the journey begins, rather than concludes.  The staff is cogent and kind, pouring pints well and mixing the strongest T&T's I've ever had.  Think Patty's Pub, but with more grit and less Frank Reynolds.
author: Michael D.

description: This place had one of the best fish and chips platters I've tried in a long time. 2 very large pieces of cod, light and not greasy and the fries were crispy. For the money, it was a bargain. The shepherd's pie wasn't bad either. The bartender was friendly although service was slow because they were short-staffed that night.
author: K. G.

description: I used to think the name of this bar sounded depressing. But, when I finally came here, I found out that this bar is pretty cool. It has a nice dive bar feel to it, and has two floors. The pub food here is decent, and everyone who comes here is pretty friendly. Good selection of beers on tap, and it's usually not too crowded here. Only bad thing is that there is only one bathroom here, and it's located upstairs.
author: Mars F.

description:
Great pub.

I love the upstairs with the ping pong tables and pool tables. Great multi-level atmosphere, I've been here several times and it offers all the staples of a good pub.
author: Roxy G.

description: I'm a big fan of the Tuesday night trivia and I like the cozy upstairs darts area.  It's one of the bars in the SFDA (www.sfda.org).  Also has a pool table.  Guinness on tap.
author: Jersey M.

description:
Swung in here to catch some NBA playoff action and to tilt a couple.  True pub feel, really laid back, cool tunes, full bar action and a nice and efficient bartender (who also had no problems bringing food to his tables) an extra star just for him.

4 pints of Guiness and approaching the final quarter, we decided on ordering a little food to put something in our stomachs.  I try a little of someone's Chicken Picata (bout $9) but it was way salty.  Too bad cuz it looked pretty decent for a pub.

 I ended up just munching on a basket of steak cut fries to enjoy with my multiple pints of Guiness.  Strange, cuz someone once told me I may have been an Irishman in a past life, and here at Bitter End, it really made sense.  What can I say, I'm one easy stout guzzlin', potato grubbin', game watchin' mofo.   Some days, I'm easy like that.
author: D.wight L.

description:
This place is dead most nights with the exception of trivia night and nights when bands play.

$3 beers until 8pm is a NICE touch - plenty of seating and a cleanish bathroom. 

Cheap food - but its not that spectacular. I had the Burger and it was mediocre. 

Decent neighborhood spot.
author: Jessica L.

description: Great classic bar on Clement. Love trivia on Tuesdays!
author: Bridget B.

description:
I've been going here on and off or years. Really cool place. Friendly staff. lots of beers, plenty of space and places to sit.
The food is actually really good. Better than most pub grub.
author: Geoff H.

description:
I like this place. I kind of like everything about it. I like the set up, the beers on tap, the people, and the fact that they have trivia. Haven't been here to a trivia night yet, but the idea is pretty appealing. Some nights this place is crackin, and other nights...not so much. It's a great place to bring a friend who is either new to the Richmond scene, or just new to the city in general. It can be pretty easy to have a conversation here, and other nights...more difficult. 

Definitely a great spot to check out on Clement St. any night of the week!
author: Lauren S.

description:
**This review is for Tuesday Trivia**

LIKES:
1. Roomy interior!  You don't feel totally squished.
2. Funny question themes like "Dead or Alive" (FYI - The actress who plays old Rose in Titanic is still ALIVE...but no one would listen!) and "Jew or Not a Jew" (No joke).
3. Your answers are scored by another team so they at least try to maintain some modicum of integrity...which is always nice.
4. Bar food IS available...I didn't order them, but I know I'm in luck when I'm getting my trivia on and need a huge @$$ plate of nachos.

GRIPES:
1. Better lighting upstairs, yo!  We need to be able to see our winning answers when we're kicking everyone else's ass!  Just kidding...kinda :)

I wish I could take credit for this, but alas, from another team, Trivia Team name WIN: "Women are like math problems; if they're under 18, do them in your head."
author: Alice C.

description:
If you decide, Marcus is such a recluse like an Axl Rose or Howard Hughes, so hard to find! And you need to find me to present me with an award such as "Most likely to be reincarnated as a Standard Poodle" (I have such an award) you can find me on Tuesday Night at the Bitter End. 

Now I wish I could give a separate review for the Waitress who does a GREAT job. I have a weird thing that I do not like being on shared tabs (I need to get past this but this is not the point of the story..) and she is very cool about giving me a separate check. 

Good beer specials and great trivia nights..
author: Marcus R.

description: This is a great place to hang out with friends and maybe play a game or two of darts or pool.  The darts and pool table are located at the second level.  It's pretty cramped when it gets packed up there, but I think it adds to the experience.  There are several tables at The Bitter End to drink beers and eat some food if you are willing to take a chance with their kitchen.  I've never ordered food here, but I've never heard anything bad or good said about it.  No news is good news, right?
author: Jules S.

description:
This is one of the best dive bars in this area. Their PBR specials are nice, especially after a long day's work. There's an area for groups, an upstairs area, plus the drinks are fairly priced for San Francisco.

I keep this place in mind when I'm in this area, so if you're around 6th@ Clement and would like a place to relax, consider this spot!
author: Rob L.

description: I live no where near this bar but if im in the neighborhood I always make a pitstop
author: Ryan M.

description: Worse pub ever! Rude service...
author: Demanding T.

description: it certainly is.
author: Misha T.

description:
Since our friend claimed The Bitter End was "his" bar, we decided we had to stop by "his" bar for some drinks. The place is small, loud, dark, good atmosphere. $15 is a good deal for a pitcher of Newcastle.  I had to pee so bad when we came in so I went straight to the bathroom and GROSS GROSS GROSS. What kind of "woman" pisses ALL over the seat? Did some drunk dude decide to use the woman's restroom and be a complete asshole and piss everywhere? It smelled so bad but I had to go real bad so I wiped the seat down. DISGUSTING. 

Nevertheless, I can totally see why this is *the* local bar and it's totally a cool place to hang out but the bathroom experience really turned me off. I'm going to 540 next door, kthnx.
author: Linda Y.

description:
Tuesday nights here for Trivia Night are the best - it's super packed so get there 60-90 minutes early if you want to have a table/seat with friends. Food is decent, service is slow except for drinks which are great and prices are solid too; the bartender is a funny man.  Where I fell in love with Newcastle.

Pool tables and kegs (to sit on) are upstairs, more quiet area away from the big crowd downstairs.

Bathrooms are disgusting, but it's a bar, who cares.
author: John D.

description:
I live in the neighborhood. This stretch of Clement is almost entirely Asian. The Bitter End is sandwiched between Chinese restaurants and markets. I wanted a drink one afternoon after getting home early from work and decided to try out this pub with my very Scottish looking roommate at the time.

The place was virtually empty, with only a handful of people inside, and a waitress in her 20's walking around, looking bored out of her mind, pacing back and forth. The place was dead.

Nothing to do this afternoon, a beer sounds good. We sit down. The waitress walks by, gives me a dirty look, says nothing. Er, okay. Maybe she has another order she has to take care of first. We start chatting. It becomes obviously clear she's doing nothing. She's chatting with some others there, and staring at us, trying to burn holes in my head or something with her English x-ray eyes, apparently.

We try to flag her down. She doesn't move an inch. She's just chatting with some regulars, staring at us. This stand off goes on for awhile. My roommate says, hey, let's just go. They obviously don't want us here. I say screw that, I'm not leaving till I get a drink. I didn't really care before, but now I'm not getting up till she brings me my beer.

We're sitting for half an hour in this empty bar and the waitress finally rolls her eyes and walks over.

"What do you want?"

Roommate orders Guinness. I order a pint of cider.

She comes back, throws down the bill, slams the drinks onto the table, and walks away without even looking at us.

I finish half my drink and leave, paying the bill and leaving a tip of a penny -- so she knows I didn't just forget to leave one.

Read the other one-star reviews. They mention the racism. F--- this place.
author: Perci N.

description:
I've must have been to the Bitter End at least a dozen times.  Its usually because my friends want to hang out and drink a little bit.  Seems like everyone's having a great time when I've walked in there and the seats are clean.  The crowds there have been pretty mixed from what I have experienced.  Then again I'm sure it depends on what's going on around there.  

I'm not one for drinking but I definitely don't mind going there.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Eh.  I wasn't really impressed with this place at all.  It was hot and just didn't have a good atmosphere.
author: Kacie M.

description:
I really wanted to like this pub. 

They have a decent menu (their french fries with a side of curry sauce is really good) and it's pretty much your stereotypical Irish pub. 

The only real issue that I have with them is the fact that when my husband came in with his service animal, we argued with the staff for about 20 minutes before they got an understanding that denying him service would have been illegal-- but you know, that's not even what made me angry, because I understand that they have policy that they have to follow, and sometimes people think that their rules supercede federal law-- totally understandable...

What pissed me off was after the situation had been resolved (or so we thought) the waitress comes up to serve us and starts talking about how pissed off she was, and how she thought he could have handled it better. 

I understand that sometimes, people can be very protective of their workplaces, but that shouldn't give one an excuse to pop off at the mouth because they feel like it. There's a little thing called professionalism, and that was something that this waitress definitely lacked when she had her little "outburst". 

I guess they named it the Bitter End for a reason.
author: Diane N.

description:
Have you ever had a really cute waiter (and not even like he's only cute because you're wasted) serve you a humongous, perfectly grilled mushroom burger with the juice dripping down your fingers while trying to figure out the name of the essay MLK wrote in jail on trivia night? 

Tues is trivia night at the Bitter End.
author: Emily F.

description:
This is one of those bars you find yourself in because you happen to be on Clement Street meeting friends for dinner or picking up something tacky from one of the many $.99 stores in the neighborhood or wasting an entire afternoon in Green Apple books before your friends rescue you from certian financial ruin. 

You go in, maybe shoot a game of pool upstairs, have a beer, a good conversation. With the exception of Tuesdays (trivia night) you tend to interact primarily with the people you came in with, and have a reasonable time.

Then a few years pass and you find yourself on Clement Street again, with different friends this time around, and you walk into this bar and say "This is a decent pub, but, gosh, I didn't miss it at all in the two years that have passed since I was last here". 

Yea, its kinda like that.
author: Drue C.

description:
"Heath Ledger Also Made a Pencil Disappear In Brokeback Mountain"

...that was our team name at Trivia Night...I didn't really get it, but apparently the MC did and he liked it and gave us free shots for best team name, which was a good start to the night...at least we won something, right?

Trivia night (Tuesday) is my new favorite night of the week.  Granted I am not very good, but my team was a bunch of smarties which helped.  I've been reading up on Wikipedia this week though, so watch out, next week I am going to unstoppable.

Pitchers are also only $10 which is awesome...and they have a killer juke box...so many good artists I never know what to choose...the Eagles...the Beatles...the Rolling Stones...Elton John...Stevie Wonder...too many choices.  

They also have pool and darts, neither of which I've played yet...I'm more of a Erotic Photo Hunt type of girl...
author: Katherine C.

description:
Pitcher fans welcome. Looks like I'm not able to order a single beer here....
I always end up ordering two pitchers at a time and then I find myself on a Thursday night, around 11PM, wondering:" is this the same place? Where are all these people coming from?".
Metamorphosis.....
From neighborhood pub to loud and uber-crowdy bar.
Aaaayt! I liiiiiiiike..
author: Dario B.

description:
Went for the first time on Tuesday for their weekly pub quiz and had so much fun I almost slapped myself in anger for never coming here before.  

I love pub quizzes, and Bitter End really makes it fun with its singalong, it's contests (free shirt raffle, free round of shots for team with funniest name), and the entertaining and witty pub quiz master, Tim.  M

The crowd is lively and friendly, and even though we had a large group (15 people), we were all able to get seats - we just had to split up to form 4 different teams.  One of my friend's teams actually won the team name contest with, "If the glove don't fit, you still go to jail for armed robbery" Haha... Hilarious! It's based on crowd applause, and people really love the witty names based on current events. The crashed plane in SD joke was mean though...

We ordered food there and it was so-so, but you really can't complain about $10 pitchers of C- and PBR. I had dinner and about 5 beers and only paid $17!

Definitely coming back next Tuesday! See you there. I'll be in an ugly Christmas sweater.
author: James C.

description:
I really liked The Bitter End. We went there to watch the Lakers game last night, and no one threw food at us! WooHoo! I didn't even hear a moan or groan from anyone hatin' on the biggest TV in the house showing the Lakers playing! This is a plus in my book. Although, it could have been because most people were too busy drinking Irish Car Bombs than to care about what we were watching. 

The food was great. We got a Bacon Avocado Burger and a grilled cheese sandwich (with fries of course). Both very tasty! Plus after two pitchers and a pint our bill came out to less than $50. Not bad! They have $3 any draft pints until 8p.m. M-F, two dart boards, two pool tables, a few TV's, nice bartender and waitress, and tons of people in there 20's and 30's. So far this is the number one spot in my quest for Lakers bars! Now all we need is to find some fans!
author: Casi C.

description:
This place is a'ight.  Fireplace, pool table, darts, douchey bartender.  Trivia night is filled with people who listen to the Dave Matthews Band, which sickens me.  I mean, really people?  Seriously?  Y'all suck donkey balls.  My friends and I answered all the music questions correctly except for the DMB question, because DMB is retarded and I enjoyed laughing at all of you for being retarded.  I got the Decemberists question, while all of you had question marks lurking over your heads, douchetards.

Also, dudes hang out here who don't like women who play video games and watch anime.  

But I somehow end up coming back to this place, but rarely and I seem to forget why I don't like this place until I come back.
author: Christina S.

description:
Tuesday trivia night will knock your socks off.   I know this because if I can lose the bottom tray to my invisalign after winning 2nd place in trivia, you can lose your socks.... just this once.

No one drinks tequila at a pub, Kristin - let's get this straight next time.

5 pooltablesdartsandboozeequalsharmony stars
author: Kelly H.

description: I've only been here during trivia, and I love it! Trivia starts at 9, but beware, you MUST get here super early. I came with 4 people and got there at 8:20 and we had a really hard time finding seats, we had to awkwardly sit up stairs. They always have a $3 beer special, last week was Anchor Steam, so you know it isn't some shitty college beer. The trivia is always fun, and pretty tough. I thought I was good at trivia, but somehow there is always a team that has several more points than everyone else. I'm pretty sure at least those people end up cheating, because the music section is fucking hard. I've been around 6 times for trivia - I will be coming back more!
author: Ashley H.

description:
You should be here.  I should be here.  This should be your Irish Pub.

Guys: Everything you're looking for in a pub is here.  Cheap booze, greasy Irish grub, crusters, pool, smoking upstairs, guy in a full suit of armor and tuesday night trivia just to name a few.

Girls: There are so many guys here its ridiculous.  The ratio on any given night is anywhere from 8-1 to 10-1...and this ain't no arbitrary stab at a guess based on like, the 2 times Ive been here.  Believe me, years and years of research have gone into this.
(just a note, i suppose all the pub-y attributes that appeal to guys, will probably appeal to you ladies as well)

So girls, if you could use some of that much needed (straight)male attention, sit at the bar and I guarantee something with a penis will hit on you.

More importantly, you WILL have a good time here, no matter who you are. 

Ask for a "Skittle" from Pascal, one of the regular bartenders.  It will either be one of the best drinks you've ever had, or one of the worst.  Ive seen it go both ways...Either way, he'll do a jig upon request.  
Totally worth it.
author: Ryan R.

description:
Three star review huh? Don't take this to mean I do not have strong feelings about this place, I do.

First off, the bar itself.  No Smithwicks so not going to be my favorite Irish bar, but on cold nights in the Richmond, the little fireplace is a nice touch.  A rickety pool table is also good to pass the time.  I actually like the place to come in and grab a calm drink.  Would have given it 4 stars based on that, except for: 

Triva night.

My hat goes off to Tim for running one of the best ones I've been to.  The pace and his humor running it were spot on.  Really a ton of fun.

EXCEPT FOR THE RACIST CROWD

I don't mean one or two little crowds of insecure fratboys, but rather, the whole crowd on Tuesday August 29th.  Here is why:

As you all know, you have to have a clever (and likely off color) name to be a successful pub quiz team.  It is a fine line.  For example "You, Me, Dupree and this Empty Bottle of Percoset" is perfect.  "Owen Wilson is almost as Dead as His Career," not quite as funny.  

"Gone-Gone-Gonzales" references a current event, should garner a good cheer in liberal San Francisco, but ultimately not all that clever (but still a good name). A team name like "Your doing a heck of a job Gonnie" would have been funnier in my opinion (referencing Mike Brown former head of FEMA and bush crony).

Here is what is NOT funny. 

"Now Alberto Gonzales can tile my bathroom for $2 an hour."

We all understand what this means, and I really don't have to go into it. But, whenever this team name was mentioned, there was the loudest cheer from the crowd. By far. raucous cheering. 

I know what you are thinking, people are happy that he was gone.  There were other team names that referenced his departure, but this is the only one that employed a racist stereotype.  Even after Tim pointed out that the cheers were making SF look less tolerant than Texas, people still cheered.  F'in clueless.   

I am Chicano, and the first generation not to be a migrant farmworker.  I am proud of my family's history, and think that the work is honerable.   That means that I think that the guys that stand on the corner looking to "tile your bathroom" deserve your respect. To all you spoiled little USF students in the bar, the people picking up trash, cleaning your classrooms, and keeping your pristeen little campus manicured deserve your respect.  And they deserve more than $2 an hour. 

I am no fan of Alberto Gonzales, and understand better than most why he was so problematic.  I don't think he deserves respect, and I'm glad he is gone.  But that does not give license to denigrate a whole people through racist stereotyping.             

To the previous poster who thought that there wasn't racism in this bar, think again. Obviously more than a few Yelpers have noticed this. When a whole bar cheers for something like this, there are problems.
author: Nicholas E.

description:
This is my favorite place to be on Tuesday nights for its ridiculous trivia night.  

Things heard at trivia night:
1.  Tim was 3 when he started popping his collar and when his mom was gang-banged by 30 paraplegic midgets.  
2.  I wish Tim would sit on my face so he could eat his way to my heart. 
3.  I like my whiskey like I like my women,  12 years old.
4.  Fuck the ho ass lakers.  

These I think where all Trivia team names.  That alone definitely deserves 5 stars.  The crowd here is super lively, uber intelligent and the bar and wait staff are friendly enough, that for at least Tuesday's, The bitter end gets 5 stars.
author: patrick o.

description: I like this bar. The music is good, in a "classics, but not oldies" way that spans a few decades, and avoids top 40s songs. After nearly stumbling into a game of darts, I located the [relatively clean] bathroom upstairs. S'a fun place, good vibes, and the bartender makes a real good white russian, with Grey Goose instead of the generic stuff. Definitely going back if I'm drinking in the Richmond area!
author: Skye L.

description:
OK, so stairs?  They are the enemy of my lifetime when I am drunk.  DANGEROUS!  One star gone.

Otherwise, hooray for The Bitter End!  The name... it's catchy.  The beer... how can you go wrong at a pub?  There are booths to play dice and socialize and whatnot.  And there's a TV to catch the latest San Jose Sharks game.

Even though I don't enjoy the stairs, the set-up is pretty cool.  Upstairs there are a few pool tables and dart boards.  And from there you can look down at the bar.  

While you're there, have a shot of Fernet!  It'll make your tummy feel warm.
author: Shannon M.

description:
Three stars for now, with a potential for four stars in the future. 

I liked the irish pub decor.  The beers were good.  I had the Bitter End Burger.  Pretty good but certainly not close to the best pub burger I've ever eaten (Liverpool Lil's is better).  I liked the fries.  I intend to try the fish and chips next time. 

Also, the bar has trivia on Tuesday nights at 9pm.  I plan to come back for that.

Update - I finally made it back for trivia night.  It gets crowded.  Get there no later than 8:30pm if you want a seat.  Even then, it's hard to find one.  The trivia is tough, but it was a lot of fun.

Update II - went to trivia again.  Still lots of fun.  Try to get there no later than 8 if you want a seat.  That place gets packed early!
author: Angie C.

description:
Looking for a cool pub to hang out at? This might be the place for you. 

I came here on my 2nd pub crawl for St. Patrick's Day and immediately noticed this was a pretty cozy place. There was a quiet upstairs area to hang out and play pool at and the the downstairs was more of a cozy feeling. 

I went to the bar but my buddy could not make a decision on what to drink so for the next twenty minutes the bartender ignored me. Luckily the owner was at the bar hanging out and was cool to talk to.  He was serving up free beers too, which was awesome. 

The music played that night was eighties music with a hint of some Irish music. It was entertaining seeing people dance to the Irish music.

I enjoyed the atmosphere and I will giving them a pass on ignoring me for the drink. I understand the bar was busy and a little overwhelming, also having the owner there eased everything.
author: Pete N.

description:
Strolled in here on St. Patrick's day.  The place was packed, wall to wall, with the usual cast of shrieking morons.

Some girl begins pushing me from the back.  I inform her that she is, in fact, a moron, and to please refrain from shoving people she doesn't even know.  Her neanderthal friend attempts to take a swing at me.  Suddenly, entire crowd is attacking me.

And the service still sucks.
author: Philippe N.

description:
I love the Bitter End. 

I love Tim. I love Tuesday Trivia. I love Liam. I love the overall crowd and atmosphere. I've been coming here for a long, long, while and I never get tired of it. 

Beer Specials: Always - even when it's not officially happy hour they offer different beer specials.

Crowd: Awesome - everyone is super friendly.

Staff: The Best!

Tuesday Trivia starting at 9 - Ridiculous! Make sure you get there early if you want a table and some seats! 

Bitter End is a great place if you want to hang in with friends or meet new people!

PS. Trivia on Tuesdays and Tim are awesome!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Whether it's briefly popping in on St. Patrick's Day for some sort of Irish-themed drink with 50 bazillion people screaming the lyrics to "Living on a Prayer" or a chill nosh session of fried goodness with a pitcher of cider (okay, with a little salad thrown in there too), this place has never made me feel bitter when I've ended up here.  

It can get busy on more traditional drinking nights like any other bar, but with 2 levels to roam in and 2 pool tables, it seems a little roomier than most places.  Anywhere that you can get your food and drink in the same location is usually golden in my book.
author: Sus... B.

description:
My bf and I LOVE this place.  Where else in the world can you get $3 Stellas during happy hour?  Awesome!  The food is actually pretty damn divine for pub food.  Actually - strike that - pretty damn divine period!  They make garlic mash that takes my English bf right back to home.

Tuesday nights bring the best quiz night in the city.  We adore this place.  The ambience is super cool and feels authentic instead of these pub-esq places. 

Very comfy, great people, great food...just a home run all around. 

Cheers!
author: Melissa W.

description:
No bitter endings here, except when I get my tab. Yikes! But I like this bar, in spite of its assault on my wallet. 

When the circumstances of the evening are such, and my mood is just right, I'll end up here for a drink or two, and somehow the night will turn into something fairly memorable...

It's got a great classic rock soundtrack. It's got a FIREPLACE -- one of two perfect ingredients for a foggy evening out on Clement Street (the other being booze, of COURSE, and they have that, too). 

It's got that cool rickety upstairs with pool tables, and they let ya smoke up there. I don't smoke, but I still like to hang out up there. You know -- with the cool kids. It's like the back of the bus, only in the bar.

It's the one joint with the power to occasionally lure me away from my beloved 540 Club, just one block up on Clement. For those of you who've experienced the lure of the pink elephant, you know what I'm talking about...

That makes the Bitter End pretty sweet.
author: Lisa T.

description:
A close friend and I would go to The Bitter End often on a whim for either a quick drink before dinner or a long drawn out talk about our men.  We'd bitch and whine and then leave there thinking how appropriate that we ended up here again at The Bitter End as we lament over guys in our lives (past and present).  It's a decent sized bar with plenty of seats and usually nice bartenders.  More recently, I've had some of their bar food.  I recommend their burgers and their appetizer sampler (tons of greasy goodness in their chicken wings and/or tenders, fries, onion rings and fried zucchini).  Definitely bar food done right.  My boyfriend, who is a bit of a burger connoisseur (and a burrito one) quite enjoyed his burger there.

Went on St. Patrick's Day too...fun crowd and good music.  Bartenders were quick and friendly too.
author: Marie B.

description: Relaxed, enjoyable. Very friendly Irish waitress. Food okay for pub food, nothing impressive. Mostly college/young crowd. I liked the darts and pool upstairs. Would definitely come back!
author: Dylan H.

description:
I only wish I could make it out here for the Tuesday night pub quizzes more often, but waking up at 5:30am for work everyday doesn't make for a nice Wed. morning.  

The vibe is really cool and chill here.  Happy hour drinks are about $3 which I can't complain about and everyone around the bar is so friendly!  It woulda been even better if I was any good at the trivial questions, but it was an adventure seeing how much my friends and I were struggling.

If only going into work that early was optional...
author: Tom Y.

description:
I am on a constant quest to find chip shop fish and chips that even remotely compare to the ones in the UK. This quest, which has been going on for my entire adult life (don't laugh - I AM actually an adult), came very close to being completed on my trip to The Bitter End. 

The shape of the fish wasn't right at all and the chips were crap, but the taste of that amazing, deep-fried cod was almost perfect. Of course, instead of 3 or 4 quid, it cost $11. 

I am thisclose to giving up and just accepting that this is as good as it gets.
author: Ali L.

description: Loved that this blues bar permits walk-ups to come on stage and jam with the house band.  Of course, this was a Saturday night and all other nights might not be created equal, but I did enjoy my short visit to this bar.  Definitely not a place for collared shirts ;)
author: brian w.

description:
A girl walks into a bar... (wait it gets better) ... and orders two margaritas (in a beer type bar, but the girl was already drinking margaritas so...) 

The Bartender says "Eight", 
The Girl says "What", 
The Bartender says "Eight!." 

The Girl hands the bartender a $20, thinking "okay. she must mean eight dollars each."  

The Girl gets back twelve dollars in change and two LARGE excellently mixed margaritas and a kind, toothy smile from the red haired Irish bartender... 

The Girl skips back to the table to give me my margarita and relay the tale.  We all are Laughing!  and We are all Smiling!!!  There are other girls drinking pitchers of beer and playing dominoes.  The music is LOUD (maybe, well, completely too loud... but they don't care) There is green everywhere on the walls and people are hanging around, enjoying a good time. 

The Girls decide to go upstairs to the pool / darts area in an effort to escape the music volume.  People are smoking upstairs (cool if your into it, annoying if you don't smoke.)  There are metal darts! Metal Darts!!  not common.  

Two of the girls decide to go home.  After checking in with the cheeky aforementioned Irish bartender (she REALLY knows how to mix a drink), they decide to wing it with the cab.  The bar is so popular with the right crowd that a cab pulls up to drop off more patrons as they walk out the door.  What a happy coincidence.  The $4 cab ride home leaves the girls safe and contented, on the way to bed with daydreams of salt rims and tequila dancing in their heads. 

The End
author: Suzanne L.

description: Eh, decent bar food, beer, a few pool tables, nothing special.
author: Alex H.

description:
Great bar. Good beer on tap. Good pub atmosphere. 

They have darts and pool tables upstairs. 

The bouncer/door guy Chris is always good to talk to on smoke breaks.

It can get a little crowded at peak hours, but you can always duck over to Dogs Bollocks or Rockit Room and wait for it to empty out a bit.

Great place to bring friends from out of town.
author: Jay C.

description:
What a difference between night and day at this place! 

I trolled into this place on a Sunday a month ago after a liquid brunch at around 2pm at it was empty and smelled like dirty drains.  My pal and I swore never going back.

Last night, after leaving the raucous 540 Club on a Friday evening, I trolled back to The Bitter End for a quick beer before dinner at B Star. Well, my pal Nicole and I never made it to B Star and stayed at The Bitter End for 3 more beers AND stayed for dinner. 

Yes, this place has dinner!! 

And we were able to grub on steak fries, fried zucchini, cheese sticks, chicken tenders, baked beans, and sausage rolls sans the dirty drain smell!

Oh, the sausage rolls were a bit of a mystery- not sure what kind of sausage it was but it was close to faux meat. The flaky crust was exquisite but the meat in the middle was like a soy gimmick.

Anyhoot, the staff is really friendly and attentive. The crowd is cool- not a bar full of cheeseburgers and their fluffy admirers. Just normal people enjoying good food and cheap beer; although there was this one guy sitting next to us whose eyes were so spracked out and he was downing 3 shots and a beer in a few minutes- but he was harmless, so be it!
author: Jonny M.

description:
I effing love Bitter.  Down the street from 540 and a place that my girls and I like to settle down into when we are tired of the crowds from up the block.  It is definitely my more frequented spot, as there are pool tables and nice booths for some good chats with friends.  Sometimes, depending on who is bartending you can get away with smoking on the upper level but open the windows.  It is an unspoken thing really.  I am not a smoker but I always see people doing it upstairs while playing pool.  

Some nights they have trivia, I believe on Tuesdays so if you are into bar trivia it is a good spot.  So many different types of people frequent Bitter, as well as many many locals. I always run into old high school classmates here which has its perks and not. Anyways it is a awesome Avenues spot.
author: Crista Y.

description: I think I would like this bar better A) if I drank, and B) if I were a student a USF. I'm not saying I'm not down to coug it up with a college boy (because I am), more that it is generally pretty crowded. I like the upstairs a lot with the pool table, darts, and general hangout areas away from the crowed downstairs area. The bartenders seem nice, and it's super easy to catch a bus or a cab when you are done for the night. If I still lived on this side of the park I would definitely try to rally my friends and turn this into our local hangout. But if I'm in that neck of the woods, I would still stop by and say hello.
author: Nora S.

description: Came here on a Saturday night and really found it to be the best of all the bars me and my friends featured that night. crowd was pleasant and the bartenders were the same. The decorations on the wall are fun and most are of Rolling Stones nature. Beer selection is fine, but I'm a bit of snob so I would have wanted to see more awesome craft brews. Racer 5 on tap so that kept me happy. A large selection ciders as well, which was nice because that's what my girlfriend prefers. If i venture to the Richmond/ Clement area again I defiantly come back again.
author: Zachery H.

description:
This bar is not trying to make a statement.  This bar is not insecure about anything (from the sticky floors to the lopsided pool table).  This bar isn't for people who want to be seen or who need to impress anyone.  This bar will never be mentioned on the society pages.  It is not particularly a straight bar, or a gay bar or even a white bar.  One can order a Corona or a Stella and not be laughed at.

This is a perfect bar for a small group of friends who want to drink a simple beer together.  Period.
author: Carmen D.

description:
I went here on a Tuesday night which is their famous Trivia night. The place was pretty packed, but not so much that I couldn't find a stool right at the bar. I ordered vodka & cranberries at $5 a piece, which is a D-E-A-L. 

The girl's potty is upstairs and I highly recommend using the handrail on your way down, especially after drinks. I mean, c'mon. 

The staff was super friendly, also which is always a plus. 

Yay neighborhood bars!
author: Teresa F.

description:
Kick-ass bar.  I don't know why I don't move closer to this place.  Cheap drinks, lots of beer on tap, they pour pitchers and take credit cards (dangerous).  There's a lot of room downstairs and you can actually sit at a table!  Upstairs there are two pool tables and you can smoke (not sure if that's official), the music was good and there's room to dance, and the hookup potential is huge... last night was like fish in a barrel.

And the best part: It's not the marina!
author: Jimmy C.

description:
This place is the shit. The shepherds pie is SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOooooooooooooOO deliciousssss!!!!! I scarfed that thing down. If you go there, you MUST try it. Very chill and cool Irish pub. There are two pool tables upstairs and darts, which is awesome.

I can't wait to come here for Tuesday night Trivia!
author: Cris L.

description: Let me just put it this way: I'm a girl drink drunk. I realize that dive bars are primarily designed to serve beer and whiskey, but you'd think an Irish pub would at least keep a bottle of Bailey's around... The atmosphere is wonderful and the bartender was quite charming, but I don' think I'll be coming back here any time soon.
author: Kathleen P.

description: I'm still a fan of this place so my rating isn't changing.  I came here last night cuz my friend lives in the neighborhood and I wanted to meet up for a drink and some dinner.  DO NOT order the Chicken Piccata!  It was sooo incredibly salty!  Mounds of capers were on my chicken breast.  I should have just gotten the fish n chips I was eyeing!
author: Elena N.

description:
Refreshingly hipster free, this is a bar that is laid back and a perfect place to get a week night drink with friends. Except on Tuesdays which is trivia night and super duper packed. If you DO want to go on trivia night and want a table, send at least one member of your team to the bar early, like before 8 p.m. (trivia starts at 9) or you are going to be stuck standing for the entire evening. Trivia is four rounds, moderately challenging, and free (with a $30 top cash prize). You can get pitchers as well which is nice when you are playing the bar trivia.

Oh, and this is like one of two bars in the entire city that takes cards. And for someone like me who never has cash, this is a selling point.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
I had SO much fun here! This place makes want to get on the 38 with all of the other drunk people heading out to the Richmond. 

Cute guys, good beer, cool music, I don't think I could ask for much more in a bar. Other then it be located closer to my apartment. 

I have heard Tuesday Night trivia can become a Marina snob city, but when I have been here on a Friday or Saturday, there is nothing but good times to be had! 

Makes me want to do an Irish Pub DYL!
author: Jessica R.

description:
The bitter end.  The bar was pretty empty when we first showed up.  But thats good for me.  We sat around drinking pitchers watching basketball and talking.  Then at some point more people started showing up and they were all heading upstairs.  So finally we moved our operation upstairs and there was some sort of game room with darts, and pool and pinball.  Lots of cute dudes playing darts.  We played pool...well my friends played and I just kept me busy with my beer.

The bartendress was the sweetest lady ever.  The food was really good for pub food.  The fried zucchini was tits.  Also they do not charge you extra money for extra ranch...even surplus orders.  The guys we were with said this pub has the freshest PBR in all of SF, hands down.  For some reason I believe it.
author: desiree n.

description:
My friends always go here, and I always end up with them. 

My feelings on the place.... 

Meh, it's okay.
author: Margaret H.

description:
A solid bar with plenty of seating and a fire place.  Upstairs is great because there are two pool tables, two dart boards.  The balcony view is nice for cruisin' because nobody ever looks up, right?  On that note, I should limit that by admitting I've never gone home with anyone I met here.  

Crowd is generally amiable, a mix of 30-somethings and students from USF.  Drinks are small but strong.
author: Amy H.

description:
Wandered into this place as we were waiting for a table at burma. With such a great name I figured it had to be good and it was.

It's a pretty good sized place with upstairs and downstairs seating, a cool bar with friendly bartenders, and they serve really tasty bar food. (hamburgers, fries, onion rings etc.)

A great meeting place to have a drink and some fries before you venture out into the night but also a great place just to hang for the night.
author: Josh J.

description: It gets crowded during weekend nights, but go figure... It's a nice bar overall. The thing I like most about this establishment is that they didn't even ask me for ID when I was ordering a mixed drink. Heck, I don't even look 21 and they just made that SeaBreeze for me anyway. There are restaurant type seating in this bar, but good luck trying to sit down. They have a second floor which has two bar-sized pool tables and some dartboards on the opposite side of the second floor if you're bored talking downstairs with your friends.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
My first time to TBE was on the recommendation of a friend who lived in the neighborhood almost 20 years ago and said that he loved trivia night and had met his wife there.

With that endorsement, my expectations were high even though I'm aware that 15 years is plenty of time for a place to lose its groove. Fortunately, I wasn't disappointed.

Good questions, good competition, good quiz-master (Tim - god bless his mother) and a great bar.

I generally start off with a pint or two of Guiness before moving onto a few pitchers of the special with my friends. Add a couple of baskets of chips for the table and you've got all the makings for a wonderful night at a reasonable - especially for SF - price.

I've been back on non-Tuesday nights and although the vibe is entirely different, it's still a great place. It's a cozy little place to hang out with some friends or to take a brother who's in town visiting or to catch a game when your TV is on the fritz. They have a bunch of beautiful new plasma screens and are almost invariably willing to switch it to a sporting event that you want to watch.

Case in point, a former college teammate of mine was racing at the Prefontaine Classic - a track meet - and the folks at TBE were more than happy to watch an hour of track and field so that I could see my buddy compete.

Nothing bitter about it, except that I'm now living on the opposite side of the country...
author: Reed L.

description:
I came here with Beth S., who can make any outing an adventure, for a bit of quiz night. We got there early to have a nosh and stake out a comfortable place to call our own. The food was mostly fried, and not so good. They have Magners, so I was happy with that, and the pub quiz is pretty well organized. All in all, it was just fine, nothing special, the only hold back was the unremarkable food.

I have been back a few times since for birthday outings and get togethers, and still remain unimpressed.

It's a bar.
author: Dixon T.

description:
Who says the Richmond is boring? Well, despite the best efforts of this bar, I still can't vouch for the neighborhood as a whole but the Bitter End definitely livens things up bit. Thursday nights are a great time to go if you want to mingle, but it's also good if you're into PBR and Jager shots. Five dollars will buy a combination of the two and send you down a dark hole you'll never want to revisit. 

The layout of the bar is fairly intuitive and good for groups of all sizes. I particularly like the tables near the front because it's generally a bit less crowded and noisy. Overall it's a great place to hang out if you're in the neighborhood. 

I haven't tried the food yet but it looks pretty decent. If you're on Clement though you might as well indulge in some of the local flavors. Grabbing a plate of noodles at King of Thai on fifth and then cruising by the Bitter End always makes for a good evening.
author: Alan L.

description: Popped in here for a quick libation while waiting for a table to open up at a restaurant near by and well my beer was cold and the bartender was friendly.  This is a fairly boring review but really that sums up my experience.  We stopped in around 8:30 and it was pretty quiet but alas the evening was young.  Our bartender was very sweet and friendly so that is a plus.  I would go back on a busier night to really get a feel for the bar and maybe write a more interesting review.
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
The Bitter End turned out to be a stop 3 nights in a row when visiting my sister in San Francisco.  Granted, that wasn't the only spot we hit each night, but we always found ourselves there one way or another.  

There was a fun game that was played one night that I kicked ass in - and won my cousins and I a free round.  Great happy hour deal of a shot of jager with a beer.  Cool door guy -Chris!! and bartenders.  Awesome area upstairs where I beat 3 guys at darts and won 3 more free drinks.  Picked up some young'uns on the way out.  

Good times, good times.
author: Alyssa P.

description:
I've been looking for a place that had a good trivia night and I think I may have found it!  Their trivia consists of 4 rounds, which includes one music round, 2 round of general trivia and a round of guess who the celebrity is (pictures of kids were shown).  As another Yelper mentioned, make sure you sit near the speakers or around the bar as their PA system isn't very loud.  Those who sat closest to the doors couldn't really hear any of the music during the music round.  Their prizes weren't for a "gift certificate" to the pub either...IT WAS CASH! First place was $30, 2nd $20 and 3rd $10.  Also throughout the game they gave away t-shirts and they gave a round of shots to the best team name too.  The only downside is if you want a table during trivia make sure you get there early.  I took the advice of fellow Yelpers to get there early, which I arrived at 8 since trivia starts at 9 and there were no tables.  An hour before trivia every single table was taken.  Just be prepared to stand if you get to the pub close to 9.

Drinks were cheap too!  I think they had some beers on tap for like $3 as their drink special for the night.  I didn't order any food but it looked good when they brought it out for other patrons so I'll have to try it next week when I go.

All in all this place was awesome and I'll be returning again every Tuesday for trivia night.  It also doesn't hurt that the MC was pretty good looking too. LOL
author: Bertie Y.

description:
and so, the reign of bars-with-pool-tables reviews continues.  

the bitter end's second floor overlooks the bar and is primarily devoted to two tables.  one is situated near windows that look out to clement street, which makes for good people watching while you're awaiting your turn in a pool game.

good setup, right?  not really.  - - my opponent (jason c.) had a rail shot lined up.  the ball traveled a good 3 inches AWAY from the rail, then rolled BACK towards the corner, hitting the 2 ball in.  found out that the floor isn't level.  ...if you're going to have a pool table at your bar, it should function decently.  

- - oh, and beware of the broken chair.  i leaned back and almost fell off.

i've visited on separate occasions, and just don't find the layout or the general feel of the place to be very welcoming/inviting.
author: Ting A.

description:
My Perceived "Musts" for Tuesday Trivia Night, 9pm:

1.   Must be in college (or a big fat cheater!) to do well.
2.   Must be under 29 because this Trivia Night starts too late for my bed time!
3.   Must get there before 7:30pm to snag a table.
4.   Must build up tolerance because drink specials are in abundance.
5.   Must keep your cool when you lose miserably because you are almost 30, crabby because it's past your bedtime, and drunk because you had too many beers.

Oh, but we won best team name!!!  Raise your hands up for the late 20 year olds....woo woo!!!
author: Tabatha Y.

description:
Being a non-drinker, I can only speak for the food at the Bitter End. I've tried just about all the items on the menu and most are fairly good. 

The burgers can't be beat, and the steaks are a steal. When is the last time you found a $12.50 porterhouse steak. Don't get me wrong, this is no fine dining steakhouse, but the price is right and the fun waitresses are a howl. They also have a smokin' jukebox! 

The sides are usually mashed and vegetables or you can get fries (which rock) and vegetables. 

Here is the difference between a restaurant like the Bitter End compared to say, Izzy's -- The Bitter End's staff are still appreciative of my business, and a place like Izzy's (no like about it) just expects it. 

Dollar for dollar, I'll take the Bitter End everyday.
author: Duane L.

description:
I suppose this place would be great if I liked to drink a lot, play pool, or be around sleazy drunk people.  I don't really like any of those choices, so The Bitter End didn't make it on my top bars list.  My entertainment for the night, however, was a completely trashed girl who was walking around, draping herself over all the guys.

Of course I'll go to bars, but they have to have the right ambiance.  This place just struck me as a place for guys to pick up on girls who are like the aforementioned.  I'll look for a place that has more personality of its own, thank you.
author: Tori S.

description:
This is a fun bar, and it used to be my go-to place with my family. I stopped eating meat about 7 years ago and have to admit that I have frequented it less often since then. However, I still enjoy going there for drinks with my family, and the french fries are as good as ever! hah. My family enjoys the food, and we all love the atmosphere. 
The jukebox has a really fun selection! 
The taps are definitely not cleaned frequently enough, and I remember getting completely flat soda on more than one occasion as a kid. But all in all, even if it's mostly for nostalgic reasons, I still love the Bitter End.
author: Leila-Anne C.

description: The Bitter End....what's there to be so bitter about?  The end of the work week that you, for whatever reason, enjoyed so much, or is it that feeling of want for another round when they yell out for last call?  Or maybe it was that last sip of beer from the pint that you nursed too long?  I've heard legends that it's possibly from that unsettling feeling of defeat after losing at one of the game nights here.  In any case, I continue my search to find what exactly makes the End so Bitter.
author: Mike L.

description:
Come here on a night when there's a bit of a chill in the air, and camp out on the pews they use for seating. Maybe they're why Bitter End  feels like sanctuary -- it makes a great place to hole up with a friend or friends you want to catch up with, or just hash out your political views. I found myself slowing down and getting more clear-headed, even though I was drinking.

Sit and talk and wonder and talk some more -- arc into conversations where for a brief moment, you understand some chunk of the delicate mechanism of the cosmos . . . and yet the mystery of how your pint glass keeps emptying leaves you totally bewildered.
author: Karsten P.

description:
WHEN you go here is a very important factor in your experience. I like The Bitter End but there's a bit of a noise problem: when it's packed, the sound bounces around and it gets noisy (to be expected), but when it's Not packed, the music is often so loud as to be just as difficult to hold a conversation. 

I like dart game upstairs: that's fun. No full bar, but they have some good beer on tap. The groups I've seen when it gets crowded seem to be college age or mid-20s.
author: Kristine K.

description:
My End here  was really bitter. 

The bartender ignored me for like 10 minutes, serving multiple other people before me. When he finally did go to take my order, even though we had been there already for 45 minutes, and it was slow, when I asked for the same again, he told me he didn't have time for that and to just tell him what I had.

Okay- so honestly - I change what I am drinking all the time. Really all the time. If you drank as much as me, you would too, I mean, if I only had Martinis, Beer, and Wine I would go insane from Boredom. I find that it is best to alternate drinks with the days of the week.

Anyway, the night before at HOPR (god I still have to write that review) my friends were drinking goose and soda and a splash of cran. It got in me, it isn't my go to, so upon needing to recall it, I failed. And then when he "didn't have time" I got indignant. I was drunk. So I made us leave upon dates return from the bathroom. I wasn't rude, we didn't fight, I just asked to close out. 

So it was a bitter end. Perhaps I should have stopped there. (Guinness p&S- One bottle of wine, Stella, vodka soda... But noooooooooo- we went to another bar!!!!)

Oh, I read in SF magazine they have a good trivia night here, and I bet that is true- there were a lot of young college kids who came on in.
author: Danielle V.

description:
Thank gods for this place, as the last place we were really sucked by comparison. The bartender (Devil Boy) was great. Playing pool was also great. It was an unusual moment on a Saturday night where you can take as many sets as you want to teach a whole group of friends how to play the game and have nobody be upset or put out.

It was a great place to play and drink and the juke box played some the of the best 'old school' music I've heard in a bar in a LONG time.

Wish it were closer to my house!
author: Marz W.

description:
* update* 3/18/08
I hate this bar even more now.  They played Radiohead's "The Bends."  Are you fucking kidding me?  Granted, that album has a special torturous meaning for me personally, but who plays that album in a bar, huh?  Also, the music trivia was the most esoteric shit I've ever heard in my life.  

It was still freezing.  


My group of six was probably one of two tables in the restaurant, but the service was SO slow.  One of my friends had to get up and get me silverware, we didn't get appetizer plates, and the server took FOREVER to do anything.  As an ex-restaurant slave, I'm empathic when it's busy, but when you're just studying your cuticles behind the bar, get me my ketchup, woman!

It was dark, freezing, and generally not that appealing in this bar.  The food wasn't that terrific (and I don't hold pub food to particularly high standards).  

There was some useful advice in the ladies room:  "don't fuck [some guy's name]"  I'd tell you who it was, but you have to have your own bitter end to find out.  In the meantime, I'm going to be rubbing the warmth back into my frostbitten limbs.  I don't know why I bother leaving the Mission... the Richmond is a godforsaken land of fog and crappy Chinese food - bah!
author: Alissa K.

description:
This is the quintessential "watering hole".  This come as you are drinking joint has all of the essentials.  Large tables, a dirty bar, a separate creaky upstairs for pool, and an above average beer selection (kudos for high life)!

My friend Ameer raves about the Irish Breakfast, but we went on a Friday night and had no trouble finding a table for 6.  A few pitchers later (yes they serve actual pitchers of beer...a rarity in this city for some reason), I left very satisfied.  The speakers were turned up a little too loud for my ears, but all in all, The Bitter End rocks!
author: Mike T.

description:
I went here feeling responsible one night and ordered a coke only to be charged $3 for it, almost as much as the beers that everyone else got on special.  So much for being responsible, I would have been better off downing the beers on tap.

On a side note, I love the dart boards but the bar tender was not pleasant and seemed to be bitter that he had to give us darts & chalk.
author: Johanna W.

description:
This is my neighborhood bar and we go a couple of times a month or so.  They have really good pub food and I especially enjoy the California chicken sandwich with bacon and avocado--my boyfriend prefers the fish and chips or burger.  It's all good and yes we try to avoid Tuesdays because it's way too loud and trivial.
Thy have a pool table and dart boards that have seen better days but you can smoke upstairs if that interests you and the jukebox is fun and loud.
Good Guinness pours but not as good as Ireland's 32
author: Jennifer L.

description:
A true Irish Pub in the Inner Richmond where new friends are made and old friends get reacquainted.   Remember hitting the pubs in College when you and your best friends would put down a few pitchers while revisiting stories of parties past and discussing the  possibilities of the future?   Ever seem like those earnest and hilarious discussions become a rarity  as you get older? 

Trust me, grab an old friend and go to the Bitter End and  order a pitcher of your favorite Irish brew,  grab a booth by the fire and you will not be disappointed.   Very few bars in this city evoke the feeling of those college nights the way this dive pub does allowing a group to relax and simply enjoy each other's company with total lack of pretense and BS.   

You will never regret a night spent at the Bitter End with a few good friends.
author: sean b.

description:
I tend to prefer my bars served one of two ways: sexy and interesting with inventive cocktail and decor or old fashioned and throughly infused with bar-ness. The Bitter End is a solid example of the latter.

It gets pretty crowded and rowdy late on weekend nights, but the rest of the time it's a very low key, burger and a beer (and maybe a ball game)-type place. Dim light, a nice beer selection, ample seating, and the awesome Irish lady who's often behind the bar make for a totally satisfactory experience. The burger, fish and chips, chicken sandwiches, and fried mushrooms all do their jobs throughly well. Plus, I've noticed that always charming trend of my G&Ts getting stronger with every subsequent round. Basically, this place is a keeper.
author: Martha S.

description:
Hooray for this place.
I've been in on the busiest and slowest of nights, and I always have a good time. 

Great people work here. Great beer on tap. Things to do besides gawk at a TV (like many a pub today) such as darts, dice, pool, pinball, food...mmmhhmm. 

I love it here, everyone I've brought loves it here, and you should love it here too.
author: Vicky V.

description:
Cheap drinks!  Not too crowded, even on a Friday night.  The bartenders knew the locals.  The people were down to earth.  Liked the televisions with sports coverage.  Heard they have good food.  Deer heads add character.  Several other bars in this area in case you're not feeling this one.

My advice: worth checking out if you're looking for a change of pace!  And you may need to signal clearly to the bartenders if you want a drink.  If you're sitting at the bar with an empty glass, it is not assumed that you want another drink.
author: Lindsay M.

description: Good music, super friendly bartender, not too crowded, and good beers on tap. Plus they have a fireplace!  Haven't tried the food, but it looked good!
author: Cate M.

description:
I went on a slower night so getting pitchers/drinks was a breeze. Bar tender was very friendly and people came fairly often to collect empty pitchers and glasses. The drink, drinks weren't exceptionally strong but they weren't watery either.

This is an awesome place to just hang out with friends. They got TV's, pool tables, booths to chat at, what else you want at a bar?

I will try and return on one of their trivia nights. Sounds fun.
author: Cliff S.

description:
Take this review with a grain of salt.  I was not drunk or drinking during the visit to The Bitter End.  You must and should drink if at a bar and with that here is my review 

The Bitter End: Sober Version 1.0
Loud, Crazy crowded on Trivia Tuesday, Subtle Stench of Stale Suds (ah ha ha...alliteration!) a lot of seating and upstairs pool and darts.   I felt out of place but I was sober so I WAS technically an invader of sorts.  Dark and all wood...I love those kinds of bars.  It makes me feel cozy.

The Bitter End: Drunk Version 2.0
Coming soon to a Yelp Review Near you...
author: Jay H.

description:
Im one of those people who likes to think I know something about everything. Name me a topic, I will give you more than enough information on it. Whether the information completely accurate, well, thats for you to decide. 
That being said, I placed the well-referred foot in mouth on Tuesday night. Who was the Dictator of Cambodia in 1970s? Ummm...Nixon? Needless to say, we didnt win trivia night. But there was a $2.50 beer special and I finally know who Jamie Lee Curtis' parents names are....Tony Curtis and Janet Lee.

So, Id say all of us won a little something last night.
author: Erin F.

description:
Tuesday.  Trivia.  Bring some friends, get drunk, and then at 11 find your way down to the Hush Hush.

C'mon, sing it with me!!!!!!!

I've played the Wild Rover for many a year
And I've spent all my money on whiskey and beer
But now I'm returning with gold in great store
And I never will play the Wild Rover no more.

And it's no, nay, never
No nay never no more
Will I play the Wild Rover
No never, no more.

I went to an alehouse I used to frequent
And I told the landlady my money was spent
I asked her for credit, she answered me "nay"
She said, "Patrons like you, I can get any day!"

And it's no, nay, never
No nay never no more
Will I play the Wild Rover
No never, no more.

From out of my pockets I took moneys bright
And the landlady's eyes opened wide with delight
She said, "I have whiskeys, and wines of the best,
And the words that I said, son, were only in jest!"

And it's no, nay, never
No nay never no more
Will I play the Wild Rover
No never, no more.

I'll go home to my parents, confess what I've done,
and I'll ask them to pardon their prodigal son.
And when they've caressed me as oft' times before
then I never will play the wild rover no more

And it's no, nay, never
No nay never no more
Will I play the Wild Rover
No never, no more.

And it's no, nay, never
No nay never no more
Will I play the Wild Rover
No never, no more.
author: Jesse H.

description:
Not bad, but not great either.  Try entertaining yourself by making fun of the trivia host.  That guy is a mass of wanna be college fratness topped off with a popped collar.  He also tried to 'cock block' my friend, but as the girl wasn't a blind handless blob of unattractiveness she quickly let him know she had no interest.     

The trivia can be hit or miss- especially the music section- but then
that seems to be par in SF.
author: Brian H.

description:
This is a pretty chill neighborhood bar. Probably one of the best neighborhood bars in the inner richmond...at least amongst the ones I've been to. 

I've heard the Tuesday trivia night is more pop-culture based and is way easier than the pub quiz at Edinburgh Castle. A couple good beers on tap, and they make an alright Pint-glass portion Bloody Mary.

They also let you smoke upstairs by the pool table...so if you have a boyfriend with an annoying smoking habit don't let him wander upstairs. Love it or hate it, your eyes will start watering upon your journey to the top. 

*Side note, there is a bar in San Diego that's also called The Bitter End, but couldn't be any different. Swanky, Cougar-y, Closer to the scene at Dulce or the Bubble Lounge. They are indeed "Bizarro" Bitter End brothers.
