UPDATE: I'm adding a star because of the fun Tuesday pub trivia I've been coming to for several weeks now. And one star for Tim's mom.
author: Kelly R.

description:
Praise the Sampler!  Oh, so much fried goodness!  Reminds me of college drinking days and stumbling into Denny's for their Sampler.  B.E.'s is much better because on top of the usuals you also get zucchini sticks and wings.  The Onion Rings stood out from the rest - they were perfectly shaped, perfect onion squishiness in the middle, and minimal onion from batter separation.  The Sampler of the Gods!

Praise the 2 Irish lady bartendresses!  They make running this place look like a piece of cake.  I loved sitting at the bar and watching all the action.  The main barmaid(?) propped a pitcher on top of an upside down turned pint glass, pulled the lever, turned her back on the flowing beer, did some stuff at the bar, and then returned to the pitcher in time to catch it from over flowing!  Now THAT'S talent!!

Praise the Stella!  And the next Stella!  And the next Stella!  And the next Stella!

Praise the good times and good conversation with my good buddy Jonny M. =)
author: Nicole N.

description:
This place gets four stars for being smack dab in the middle of a slew of Asian groceries and restaurants (pretty awesomely funny and strange).  It is a true pub with decent beers on tap and a generous pour (at least that is how I felt).  The first time I came here it was dead, but that was due to the fact that I was drinking at 3 on a Saturday.  
I can't really speak to the food other than a heartfelt warning against the garlic cheese fries (strange they were).  I would love to check out one of the infamous Trivia Nights, and then will update this review.
author: Sheila Y.

description:
It's allll true. Yes their trivia nights on Tuesdays are AWESOME! There's singing to a live guitar solo, free t-shirts, face and music trivia, and great trivia team names. Make sure you put something about Tim's mom...just a hint.

Yes there are usually more men, who look "normal" (whatever that means) than women.

I didn't try the food but the drinks aren't that hard to get even when it's packed.

It has a pool table and plenty of tables, but as said, get there early on trivia night. Trivia starts around 9.
author: Cassy R.

description:
I love this bar.  I love Pascall.  I love Tim and his Trivia Night.

...but people showing up at 6:30 to save seats for all their friends on Tuesday night?  No.

Fuck those fuckin' fucks.

__________

Updated June 27th 2007

This is for you Pascal:

Indoor fireworks
Can still burn your fingers
Indoor fireworks
We swore we were safe as houses
They're not so spectacular
They don't burn up in the sky
But they can dazzle or delight
Or bring a tear
When the smoke gets in your eyes

You are the heart and soul of this bar and I wouldn't give you any less than 5 stars.  ( as long as you get some Woodford Reserve in soon )
author: Patrick A.

description:
I've been drinking & eating at the Bitter End for almost a decade.  Its not far from home and the staff are welcoming.  My buddies & I used to go upstairs and play pool, drink, watcha game on the tube.

Nowaday's I sit at the bar or a bar table and eat the yummy pub food.  Its pub food dude so don't expect a tiny heart or olive branch next to the menu items.  With that said, they do pub food. right.  I have tried the bangers & mash and that always satisfies.  My favorite is the gaelic steak or chicken.  I can't get enough of the creamy sauce.

The fish & chips are bigger and better at Pig & Whistle so I don't get it here.  If you are into trivia (I'm a trivia geek) then go here on Tuesday nights.  Bring your knowledge and at least three friends though.  I've seen teams of up to 10 people.  It gets clamorous on Trivia Night and its a blast every time.
author: Pete M.

description:
The Bitter End. Yes. It. Is. ;)

Somehow I manage to find myself here on the occasion I go bar crawling in the Sunset, and this is always the last stop of the night, or the bitter end as it were. 

It's not that this bar is so downtrodden or seedy or anything like that. It's always pretty busy whenever I wander in, and I enjoy taking the view from the top and going to the second floor game area (game referring more to watching the pathetic attempts of drunk hasbeens trying to throw game at the ladies, but also the darts and pool tables).... but there is something about this place that I can't quite put my finger on. It may be bitter, but this is the end.
author: Christy M.

description:
I love yelp because I think that 67% of the people that write reviews LOVE to hear their own opinions (not excluding myself), but then again that essentially is the same for the blogospherious world we live in.

The Bitter End is the perfect Irish Pub. Try and tell me where it falls short in any category. We are talking about an Irish Pub people. Nothing is supposed to be "great" here. Pub food is mediocre, period. They do make great mediocre food though, if you are looking for the most delicious route to a heart attack get the Irish Breakfast here, it'll raise your cholesterol instantly. 

The bartenders are deliciously Irish, if you ever get Martina or Pascal tell them Sean sent you and you should promptly get a double shot of Jameson...that you will have to pay for, sorry. But the drinks are tasty, the service great, and you can play games, sit around and get wonderfully drunk, after all, sobriety can be overrated.
author: Sean W.

description: Went here on St. Patty's Day and had to body surf my way out... it was seriously so packed that if there were a small fire, everybody would be screwed. Plus, it was $5 for a red cup of Harp or Guinness... really? I go to a bar to have a beer and I get a red plastic cup? I could have gone to to a high school party for that. I guess it's easier for the bar to have red cups due to the large volume of people, but I wasn't impressed. Also, took awhile for my friends to get served (maybe because we were the only group of Asians there? Possibly.)
author: Christina B.

description: Typical British-style pub with full bar. Pool tables upstairs made a good diversion and the bartender made a tight dirty martini.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Haven't been here in a while and I'm writing to say that I miss this place.  Laid back, a little bit of everything you want in a pub.  Would hang out here w/ my buddy back in the day.  Good unpretentious, even friendly place most of the time.   Met real Irish folks here.  Glad to hear the crowd's still mixed.  

Loved when the quarter intake broke  on the pool table and we had free games for days.
author: greg e.

description:
Its all about the Tuesday's Trivia night at the Bitter End. Always a good time.

cheap beer, (decent pub food - but then again its 'pub' food, so don't expect too much now), and fun people watching.

And tons of fun with your friends. Yeah sure its a local bar with local crowd, but that depends on the definition of word local - my friends from oakland, bernal heights, rockridge, nob hill, mission...  are always showing up there, and every tuesday I find people there from all over the place around SF/Oakland/Berkeley.
author: An u.

description:
This place served me the WORST cup of coffee I've ever had. Ever. Period.

Before I go any further I will acknowledge that yes, I realize this is a bar. But it is also an "and restaurant." And it's also open for "brunch" at 11am on Saturdays and Sundays. So I'm talking about that. 

Back to the coffee. I can only describe it as mud. Thick, opaque, and heavy on the Bitter End. Cream and sugar didn't help. We were pretty much the only people in the place and I didn't want to be rude to our very friendly server, so I closed my eyes and downed most of it through a straw. She probably caught on since I refused about five of her offers to refill my cup.

And yeah, bad coffee is an indicator. As if the emptiness wasn't enough of a canary-in-a-coalmine, we should have taken the coffee as huge slabs of rock falling from the ceiling. We waited forever for our food (I didn't mind that, as they were just opening), which came out as 1) a runny gray-ish mess-of-an-omelet filled to the brim with watery tomatoes, day old avocados and a greasy glop of cheese and 2) an overcooked extra fatty steak. It may have been the most unappetizing food of my life.

I wouldn't let this deter you from either trivia night, which I hear is a blast, or the shepherd's pie, which I hear is quite good. But by all means, stay away from the breakfasts.
author: anne s.

description: What a great neighborhood joint. A pitcher of Boddingtons helps the fact...
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Very Very cool place!

Tuesday Night Trivia is a blast.  Bring a group of people and see if you've got the brain power to win.  There are four rounds; two rounds of general trivia, a picture round and a music round.  First place gets 30$ bucks, 2nd place gets $20, and 3rd place gets $10.  Very friendly atmosphere and Tim, the MC can be quite amusing at times.

FOOD:  The Bitter Burger is juicy and they don't skimp on the meat.  The Salmon with mango salsa comes with garlic mashed potatoes, a healthier alternative to bar food.  The finger foods are nice and greasy, just the way they should be at any bar.  

SERVICE:  Kinda slow on Tuesdays because of the crowds, but everyone is friendly.

AMBIANCE:  Everyone comes here to have a good time. Bitter End has a nice vibe to it.

OVERALL:  A Tuesday Night staple for sure.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
A nice standard bar with an all too prescient name.

It somehow always seems to be place of choice to go and lament the bitter end of a relationship. Having some friends with a flair for drama, at one point during an empassioned on again off again affair, it seemed we were here crying into our beers biweekly (or more accurately, watching our friend cry into his beer as we silently chuckled and rolled our eyes).

Also a great place to have a beer while waiting your two hours to get into Burma Superstar.
author: Meredith K.

description:
I live right around the corner from this place and i think its a great kick back spot.  

As other people have mentioned, they have a lot of seating, along with a pool table and a darts board.  Ive been here several times with several different number of people, and it always seems like the perfect place to go.  

As people have mentioned, their food isn't anything to write home about, but its very solid and always dependable.  By far my favorite part of the Bitter End is their selection of beer.  I know there are MANY MANY bars in SF but that doesn't mean i can't appreciate a place with a dozen or more different kinds of beer on draft.  OH and plus, 4-8PM 5 days a week is happy hour $4 beers, which is always great.

A great solid place to stop if your in the inner Richmond.
author: Mark R.

description:
What a great bar! No fuss. No "trendiness." Just a cool neighborhood bar that is usually pretty crowded. I like the set up a lot--there are high tables kind of in rows, everything dark red and green if I remember correctly... It just has a fun, warm atmosphere and seems to be a well-known bar in the area. 

It's also in the vicinity of many other bars, so if you're doing a Clement pub crawl, you should really stop in at The Bitter End.
author: Sophie D.

description:
Good happy hour. Looks bar-ish, smells bar-ish. Not trendy. Has young, energetic crowds at night. Reminds me of college. And Trivia Night on Tuesday really does live up to the hype. Pretty sweet bar.

Next time we go: we will get there at least 40 minutes early to get a seat at trivia night. It gets packed.
author: Jacob and Brianne H.

description:
Darts on the top floor. Cards and dice behind the bar. Loud classic rock. Bartender didn't know what a snake bite was. hmmm. Well fair enough, you can't be good at everything.

Busy on a raining Friday night. Average age approximately 22. I thought we were far enough away from USF on a Friday night to not be disturbed by the kiddies. I was wrong. Few games of 31 and crown on the rocks later, everything was fine by me.

Bitter End, despite bartenders not knowing what's in a snake bite and young crown, still will not deter me from loving my neighborhood. I'll be back. I'm feeling particularly nice tonight - and I expect that you'll have learnd't how to make a snake bite by then.
author: Jenny T.

description: name quite the contrast....a pleasureable happy ending to a long day out...big group seating....tables plenty...a bar with table seating all around....aged and wooden...adding dive bar charm....saturday night coming to a sweet end...$five guinness pint, an irish stout, and a pitcher of beer to end the night....farewell to saturday...
author: Hen A.

description: After coming from Buckshot...saying this place is a nice change is an understatement. This bar is much more conducive for a large group of friends to hang, drink, and enjoy each others company. The inside has a comfortable layout. If your in the area, stop by.
author: Nick C.

description:
This is a great neighborhood bar located on Clement Street, which can be some good fun at night.  But I've been here mainly after work as a happy hour bar, and it's usually pretty empty at that time of the day.  I've been there on a weekend night, and it's a cool place to warm up before seeing a show at the Rockit Room, or moving on to the 540...It's  also pretty close to where I live so I can walk home as needed, or take a 5 dollar cab ride, which a bonus.   

Dart boards upstairs are cool, however they're so messed up you can barely see the numbers on it...pool table area is pretty cool too.

I was going to give it 4 stars, but I had to deduct one star, due to the fact that one the weekends, or whenever it gets busy they allow people to smoke upstairs. gross. I don't mind cigarettes that much, but I hate them in closed, confined spaces.


UPDATE:
Went to Trivia night here for the first time...gets super packed! A bit harder than the Trivia night at the P&W but still a lot of fun...host man Tim said we should all Yelp about the trivia night too. So here I am. This should be worth one drink Tim!
author: Matthew S.

description:
Total dive/college bar (in my opinion), which can be both a good and a bad thing.  Came here around 11:30 p.m. on a Saturday night with my girlfriend.  The crowd seemed very jovial here, and it was pretty crowded.  This is a no-frills all about the drinks kind of bar.  We stood at the bar (there were no open tables), and surveyed the scene.  To our right were guys doing Irish Car Bombs (brings me back).  To our left were guys doing Jager Bombs (also takes me back).  The bartender was Irish, and really nice and sweet.  

So... the guys to our left offered to buy us Jager Bombs, to which my girlfriend said yes to, and I said no to.  Um, so we ended up doing the bombs with the boys.  Basically, the guy who bought our drinks goes to college (J.C.), is actually underage, and has a fake ID.  Hmmmm.  Don't know if I'll be back here, but it was a fun time nevertheless.
author: Sarah F.

description: Bitter End is pretty laid back pub in Richmond where my friends and I like to grab a couple drinks when we decide we want a chill night. There's a couple booths and tables everywhere and also an upstairs with pool tables which I have yet to play at. They have a full bar and the bartenders here are pretty quick and attentive. Sometimes this place is empty and other times its packed by us locals looking to get shit faced. haha. This place has introduced me to a couple new drinks, the most memorable so far suggested by a drunk patron was the "red headed slut". I will definitely continue to make trips back to the Bitter End.
author: Jackie M.

description: My first trivia night ever, had a good time.  Food was yummy and drink was reasonably priced, everyone was friendly and fun.  We got there at 845p and got the last table - lucky!
author: Loralyn S.

description:
Yet another in the long line of bars in the Richmond currently being ruined by annoyingly loud, pretentious emo kids. The weekly trivia contest is fixed (most weeks the guy who puts together the music round forms a team, and 'somehow' gets all the music questions right!), the service atrocious and crowd unbearable. Bring back Maggie O's.

UPDATE: Avoid the curry fries.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Special K is exactly right, this is a bar for normies like me. 

There are a couple of things I really like about this place, first and foremost is that they have Kronenbourg 1664 on tap. 1664 is the national beer of France and being the douchey Francophile I am I love it. It reminds me of spending my last summer hanging out with my brother before and after his wedding, playing ping pong and drinking 1664. I also love ordering any beer that's a four digit number and a year.  They even have a 1664 sign at the bitter end. I would like to steal that.

Beyond the 1664 the other beer specials are good, with good beers like Sierra, Stella, Anchor, or Newcastle for two or three dollars. Trivia night is a lot of fun and there are a lot of geography questions asked which I very much like. They have two dartboards and two pool tables so it's not hard to stay entertained. I mean overall, I dig it. 

This place makes riding the 44 over to the richmond almost worth it.
author: Alex O.

description:
My favorite bar in the Richmond. I like the layout (lots of cozy nooks and more social options), I like the decor, there's a fireplace, pool, darts, and food.

I prefer going earlier in the evening--it can get a little too loud for me later on. I like my bars like I like my men: dark and quiet.
author: Sue M.

description:
The Good:

I love the hamburgers here it is relatively cheap but very delicious.
Everything that I have ever eaten here is pretty damn good bar food.
If this was a yuppy hipster spot the food would cost tons more for the large portions that you get.
I guess thats one of the things that I enjoy that it is not a yuppy hipster spot. The customer service is always friendly and inviting. Only a few times I have went there and they had us waiting for a long time, but the food was that good that I still returned.

The Bad:
Occationally it is understaffed so it's good to go there @ a time when you feel you can get the best service. Or you might be waiting awhile
author: Dwayne A.

description:
this is a much needed respite in the heart of chinatown redux. but as a bar in its own right, it is the perfect little pub.  i wish i had a place like this around the corner. if it were, i'd drink here every night.  

wait, i'd drink here every night. that's what my bartender said too last night.  i complimented him on his bar (great good people feel, fantastic tunes, old and dim but clean and chill, great picks on tap - they even have a big cider selection and the rare strongbow's dry on tap- i took full advantage of this one) and his tending style (sharp eye, very attentive, friendly but not too friendly).  and he said that if he didn't work here he'd be drinking here every night too.  it's love like that that makes him the perfect bartender, and bartenders like him that make a great bar. 

they take AMEX and i hear they have food.  i'll be back. provided i can find a parking spot in those woods.
author: Nikki F.

description: This is simply a great bar. If I moved back to SF, I would insist on living walking distance...
author: Matt G.

description: Had a drink here while we waited for a table at Burma superstar. Great atmosphere. Good drinks. Bar tender was extremely friendly and gave a rec for another restaurant to try in the area.
author: Justin M.

description:
Best bar in the Richmond, in my opinion.  There are always people here and it never really feels too crowded, nor too empty.  Trivia nights on Tuesdays are always fun when you get a few friends together to put your collective knowledge to the test, though I must say that there are some pretty bright people who frequent this place for the trivia and my group has never won anything except for the "best team name."  Free shots ftw!  Although $30 cash money doesn't sound bad either...

In fact, I see one of our incomplete team names in "patrick o"s review!  No hard feelings.  Feel free to copy and paste if you wish though:

3.  I like my whiskey like I like my women  12 years old...and mixed with coke.
author: David B.

description:
Quiet Pub with Good Food with Roaring, Jam-Packed & Competitive Trivia Night (Tuesdays) - get there by 7:30 to get a table...

Tuesday night Trivia & FRI/ Sat nights is when this pub is at its noisiest and perhaps most fun.  The food is good for pub food (4 out of 5 stars on the pub scale) but go for this great pub environment.  Owned by UK people, this place has all that's needed to feel right at home.  Upstairs there's a dart board and billiard table (though neither can be played on a crowded night because of the risk of hitting someone).

Excellent Guinness and wonderful ciders on tap (Apple, Pear, and Raspberry Ciders - Ras is amazing & usually runs out first).  Curry fries, pretty good but eat them fresh or let them go because they don't get any prettier...  Beware of the 'car bombs', the owner gets a naughty twinkle in his eye as he doles them out 'cause it's all downhill from there my friend... not to be followed by Jaeger shots (had a very sick roomie from this pattern)...

THE best trivia night in town... but I've gone with other friends from grad school and we got our behinds handed to us on a platter these 'regulars' are so hard core.  You only get 17 out of 20 in the first round and you've already lost so you might as well relax and enjoy the chaos - the regulars rarely miss more than 2 questions per round.. is it really the 'free beer pitcher' that's motivating them?  Perhaps we'll never know...
author: Urban T.

description:
When this place gets packed, it's packed.  
They have 2 pool tables upstairs and 2 dart boards upstairs.  Ive always been able to play when I go, people are usually pretty nice and down to play teams.
Juke Box.
There is a lot of seating if you get there early enough; or get lucky.
Really good to hang out, get drinks, play pool. 
There is a trivia night too.
author: Arika E.

description:
I was again stumbling by the time I entered this bar, but I remembered not being a huge fan.
The crowd was strange.
Richmond district college kids. I'm pretty sure a lot of them were underage. I don't remember being carded.
A lot of PBR drinkers.
I DO however remember the womens bathroom sink was filled with vomit which looked like it had been sitting for hours.
They did have a funky upsstairs gameroom with darts, and pool tables.

And kids smoking cigarettes out the windows. 
 Don't see myself returning
author: Kimberly M.

description: This bar had so much potential but ultimately isn't the place for me. Lots of space, tables, wood paneling; the works. Decent amount of beers on tap, typical pub selection. I really could not handle how loud this place was. We were sitting near the front with the speaker right in front of our table, I thought I was going to go deaf with the very loud music and roar of the patrons, aka loud, obnoxious bro crowds. I'm starting to think the Richmond  bars are a brotopia? I'd rather head into the Mission any day.
author: Cori W.

description:
Often this place is quite crowded, but I come here because its convenient and they have Boddington's on tap (a personal favorite). When the place has been more chill, its a particularly nice place to enjoy a beer and some conversation.

Unfortunately its often packed. Which is great if you're in your early twenties looking to meet new people, however I'm usually absorbed in the friends I've come with. My main complaint is that the music is Sooo LOUD! The open seats are more often in the front and the sound is blasting painfully up there.

I haven't played darts or pool much lately but I would also definitely give this place props for having those available.
author: Kristine H.

description: Loved going to The Bitter End when it was a neighborhood bar for me, and still love it enough to trek to the Richmond for drinks there.
author: claire s.

description: I first heard about The Bitter End as the site of the most difficult and competitive pub quiz in SF, which, given our consistent underperformance in this sport, I haven't been in a hurry to try.  But as a spot for good old-fashioned Saturday night drinking, TBE can't be beat.  Green walls, balcony, fireplace, spacious yet cozy thanks to the extensive front room, with 4 kinds of cider on tap and a lot of classic rock being played too loud to ignore, but not too loud to talk over.  The customers are a unique and eclectic mix, quirky yet too real and unaffected to be either Marina or Mission--do I detect a bit of USF at work?  At any rate, they're the kind of peeps whose faces actually seem to brighten when Mick Jagger kicks in with "may the good Lord shine a light on you".  Or maybe that was just the good drinks and good vibes shining a light on me.  Either way, I'll take it.
author: Wes M.

description: Great place to have a drink whilst waiting for your table to be ready at Burma Superstar.
author: Mo A.

description:
My relationship with the Bitter End is like the one you have with a guy who you definitely don't want to date, but enjoy the sex... Its like, when I want you, yes.. I will call and come over. But hang out on a tuesday night, or come meet my friends probably not, because listening to you talk sometimes makes me want to barf... 

On to the review! 

Initially, I LOVED Trivia Tuesday's, its definitely something to do once.. but not many times after that.. what bothers me about the trivia: 
     1. no more Tim's mom jokes... (not because I love them so much, but because lots of teams need the assistance in coming up with quality names, which takes me to 2...
     2. The sexist bastards that play trivia.. OK, I have a good sense of humor, and am pretty laid back.. That being said, some things get to be overwhelming.. and I am a strong woman.. so there! One team name in specific was the start of my "I will never go to trivia at the Bitter End again" Team name was, "Winning trivia is almost as hard as convincing my girlfriend to get her third abortion" Seriously?! Im sure this guy doesn't actually get laid... and not only that, I do believe this name won... NOT COOL 
    3. They never can get the music round right.. problems with the songs, problems with the volume, overall lack of care from everyone there

However on a Friday night its a good dive bar to hang out at if you don't feel like leaving the Richmond.. I like the dart boards upstairs.. but there is always a lack of chalk (usually because people are drawing penises with the chalk on the walls) 

So Bitter End.. I may come over once and a while on a friday if I am feeling lazy and want some.. but you will never be more than a booty call
author: Hailey P.

description:
Full disclosure: I host Trivia Night at the Bitter End (every Tuesday at 9pm completes the plug). That said, here's my review...

I've never been to Dublin, I've never been to Chicago or Sydney or Auckland.  I've never been to Glasgow, London, Philly, or Paris.  But one recurring image I have from whatever media I've taken in over the years is The Bar.  Bar with a capital B.  Back in the early nineties when Friends debuted was the only time in history it was viable to believe that a bunch of people in their mid- to late-twenties spent the majority of their out-of-the-apartment time at a Coffee Shop rather than a bar.  The Bar is where you go to drink alone or to meet up with your friends.  It's where you start the night and where you end it.  It's where you meet the girl of your dreams or learn to seriously calibrate the beer goggles.  The Bar has every drink you can think of and quite a few select brews on tap.  The Bar also has food - but food you get when you're making a clear decision to eat at The Bar rather than go to an establishment that actually specializes in making food.  The Bar is where you see old friends from high school and sing along with songs written and performed by hip youngsters back before they were 55 and writing songs for Ford commercials.  The Bar is where you treat the bartender well but God knows he treats you better.  The Bar is where you spend your last night before you leave for war or college or the great unknown and the first night when you come back.  The Bar is where you create and leave your memories, which only seem accessible once you've made it back into The Bar.

All apologies to Alpha Bar, but that's not a Bar, that's a bar.

The Bitter End is a Bar.
author: Tim K.

description:
Four of us used "The Bitter End" as a place to wait for a table at Burma Superstar, just down the street. We stumbled in to Happy Hour from 4-8pm with $3.00 drafts, with a fairly good selection, from girly ciders (raspberry, pear, apple) to a choice of beers. There was, as other reviews say, only one bathroom, which was a little disappointing. It was strange to wait in line for the bathroom at 7pm when the bar wasn't even nearly half full! 

Seemed like a good crowd, and the service was very friendly. Would come back for trivia night!
author: Lindsay H.

description:
here is what i would like to drink: vodka, ginger ale, and a little bit of cranberry juice. this is not a drink, it does not have a name, and yet, it's very easy, please don't look at me like i just poked you in the eye.

and then: oh, it was tasty. and strong. and i was very, very pleased with you, mr. bartender guy.

this bar gets lots of points for that, and also for: pool tables, upstairs smoking, having irish pub food even though i didn't eat any of it, deer heads decorated with leis, and a suit of armor hanging over the railing from storage upstairs. 

one day, that suit of armor will be mine.

minus one star for being full of grody ass dudes (and for me being sorry i wore a dress) and being the site of my lovely friend sheaffer's going away party.
author: Irene S.

description: Like Colin, I'm not a bar person, primarily because I don't drink. I do like to socialize, however, and this is the place to do it comfortably even if you're not ordering one of the many assortments of Irish whisky, single-malt scotches, and beer the bar stocks. Anglophile that I am, I love pub grub, and here the kitchen turns out very respectable versions of shepherd's pie, fish and chips, and the spicy curry dishes found in London. On the second floor, there are two pool tables, dart boards, and pinball. Tuesday is trivia night. In the dead of winter, when the air is cold and damp with rain, or at the height of summer, when the air is cold and damp with fog, there's a fireplace to remove the chill and add to the always convivial atmosphere.
author: Gourmet G.

description: Trivia night every Tuesday is the time to go! It gets really packed so you have to leave your personal space at the door but it's good fun and it's not one of those trivia nights where the questions are elementary. You really gotta think about these and that's pretty hard to do when you're loading up on the cheap pitcher deals on trivia nights, lol!
author: Lisa H.

description: I have to admit that I live in the neighborhood, so a big part of the reason I love this bar is because it's right by my house.  BUT, that being said, I really do love it!  It's a little dirty, a little run down, the music system isn't so great, and the juke box could use a better music selection . . . but really, that's all part of the charm!  The Bitter End is one of those bars you can feel at home in.  The bartenders are quirky and friendly.  The drink selection is great (Racer 5 on tap!!!).  Trivia night is always a good time.  If you're looking for a place to grab a drink and unwind, then check out this bar!
author: Mary F.

description: A nice neighborhood pub. The curry fries were fantastic and apparently there is trivia on Tuesday nights.  I'll have to go sometime.  The only thing I was disturbed by was the dead animal head on wall thing.  Not cool.
author: Cara J.

description: trivia night is amazing. also bartenders are really really nice, once i left my jacket inside and they let me come back in after 2 am and helped me search for it!
author: Kate B.

description: I first discovered the Bitter End during my USF days and it quickly became my go to, neighborhood bar.  If you want fancy this is not the bar for you, this is an Irish Dive bar (though its no Gold Cane either).  The heavily used dart boards are a favorite past time, as are the pool tables upstairs as well.  You can find a table nearly any day of the week, except during Trivia night which is Tuesdays.  I reccomend starting with a Black 'n Tan, a personal favorite of mine, but always remember to check the small chalkboard above the bar which lists drink specials for the night.
author: Vince T.

description:
For the last 4+ years this place has been my Tuesday night anywhere from 2-3 times a month.  It's local, the staff are friendly (assuming you are too), beer specials and Fernet flow freely (not for free, but freely none the less), and the trivia makes your beer soaked brain work.  I've never found a bar this crowded mid-week, and I think it's great: sort of like pre-season for the weekend.  
The humor used ranges from hilarious to a little off-color, so come prepared and with a bit of a thick skin.  Remember it is a bar, and they serve alcohol, so there might be a drunken individual or 2, just shoo them away and you'll be fine.  If you're in a bind for a team name just  follow this formula: current events+vulgarity+Tim's mom (Tim is the trivia presenter).
With booths and tables downstairs and pool, darts, and pinball upstairs, this place can handle most anything you  can throw at it.  Use your credit card often enough and the bartender will make a point of learning your name.  Go, enjoy, decide for yourself.
author: Jacob S.

description: i can't believe i haven't updated! this has fast become our "go to" bar. LOVE it here. i spent my birthday (new year's eve) here taking shots of patron and eating mass amounts of DELICIOUS french fries. the bartenders are nice, no bullshit kind of people, the prices are reasonable, and the crowd is usually pretty mellow. i actually avoid trivia night, though, because my drunk mind can't deal with the obscure questions and the booming voice over the microphone ("why is he still talking? turn on the juke box!"). i also came here on election night and had a grand old time screaming out of joy with my fellow patrons as the vote count for obama went up and up and up....love this place. it's everything you need in a neighborhood bar "where everybody knows your name."
author: Rachael S.

description: Good place to spend some time while waiting for a restaurant in the area (I can say from experience). I got to have a Pear Cider flashback for $3.00 due to their 4-8pm Happy Hour. The barmaid was friendly and patient. The crowd seemed legit and friendly as well! I'd recommend for pre 8pm although I am not sure how things develop as the night goes on... happy drinking!
author: Jen S.

description: This is the USF watering hole. Thursdays are $5 Jager shot and PBR night. Jukebox is awesome, usually playing '80s dance music or classic  rock. Chris the bartender is really cool. The location is great because you can do pub crawls on Clement and then stuff your face at Nizario's after a night of heavy drinking, which is pretty much guaranteed at bitter end. Have had many an epic night here.
author: N. M.

description: This was my absolute favorite bar when you were still "allowed" to smoke  upstairs.  Yeah, I'm one of THOSE people.  I apologize in advance.  Anyhoo, two pool tables, reasonably priced drinks and the most awesome bartenders (and door guy) a girl could ask for, still make this spot a decent Richmond destination.  It used to have a more diverse crowd:  regulars seated at the bar and randoms throughout.  Lately it's been more open-toed shoes and button-up collared shirts.  They also have darts and some pretty darned good bar food but don't hold your breath for the "9-foot big screen" promised in the window outside.
author: Jasmine L.

description:
any place that serves alcohol to the music of bob marley, police and tom petty in the background knows the recipe for success.  chorus of bar patrons singing to "let it be" is a bonus.  mistimed burps aren't but will be forgiven due to the spirit of the game.

the only thing bitter about this place is the lyrics to the songs.
author: Andrew P.

description: I went back to the Bitter End with my friend Annie and we had two drinks and nachos. Though we missed happy hour, they make some nice nachos. All else is the same as before.
author: Christopher W.

description: My friend William has turned 49; so in a tradition which I spent years instilling among a small cohort of my friends, it was time to celebrate.  His dinner of choice will remain unnamed, because it's name would pollute the content and intention of this review.  On our way out, and towards what I assumed to be "home", William states that he needs a drink.  The Bitter End is the closest we can find, so there we are - 3 Chinamen, and an old black African dude - No problem getting a table - people were clearing tables for us as we walked in.  The trouble is I'm the  designated driver - one drink limit.  I did connect with a couple of my Irish friends there, which is really surprising, since it's not their neighborhood - but maybe it is! The fish and chips are really good.
author: Gordon J.

description:
Great bar, awesome location and incredible atmosphere!
Tuesday night trivia night can not be beat. The place gets very packed so you must arrive early and be ready to have some fun. The M.C. is hilarious and a great host, moves at a great pace and doesn't waste time judging your answers. Switching you answer sheet with another team and letting them grade as the whole bar receives the answers is a very smart move to save more time and have more questions.
After three rounds, IT'S SINGALONG TIME! With a guitar accompaniment and a lyric sheet (in case you dont know the words) the whole bar erupts in song.
Drink the night away, and have some fun on any day!
author: David L.

description: I have been here once, i remember i met really cool people and i got quick service HOWEVER i do not remember when or how i left!  I'm just assuming you get your moneys worth of alcohol!
author: Michelle M.

description:
not bad for a bar. 
the bar tenders are nice, there is usually good music. it's two stories with tables up stairs. It is a narrow place, and packed in the weekends. I would definitely go back!
author: Ashley M.

description: Solidly average; nothing bad, nothing great.  Small bar area where the TVs are at uncomfortable angles.  Pretty pricey drinks.  Other patrons were friendly enough.
author: Mr X.

description: I Heart Tuesday Night Trivia.  And there's no better place to play than the dirty confines of the B.E.  Been going to the bar every week for the past month and it's crazy packed each and every time.  Throw in one part $2.50 draft specials, one part yummy shepard's pie, add a splash of Andrew W. K. "It's time to party" and two parts RedBull...well, you get the picture.  Put "American Idol" on Tivo, slip on a clean shirt, and call up that know-it-all buddy for a trivia throw down.  Trouble is, getting a seat...Get there early, grab some pub food if you want a table!
author: Sy K.

description: Some of the reviews on here think that Tuesday trivia is a frat boyish sausage fest that appeals to the lowest common demoninator.  Well, maybe it is, but I LOVE it!  Tuesday night trivia at the bitter end absolutely rocks.  The energy level is great, its packed to the brim, there's always a $2.50 tap especial, and the dedication is crazy (some people get here at 6 to save a table).  The only negative, other than the fact that you have to get here pretty early to get a table, is that the jokes about Jim's (or is it Tim...I can never hear that part) mom are starting to get a little old.  Come on people!  Give the poor woman a break!  We can always talk trash about his grandmother or his sister.  Geez.
author: Jason S.

description: I've been coming to BItter End for years now. My first Trivia night there was today, it was fun! Won a shirt woooh! I like this casual pub because of its relaxed fun atmosphere, nice people and staff and yummy variety of beer and ciders.
author: Karen T.

description: Good, cheap pitchers of beer, a fun crowd, and a pub atmosphere that doesn't feel fake or overdone.
author: Katie S.

description:
the bitter end was decent, as far as bars go.  not like i'd suggest to come back here, but it wasn't 2-star horrible either.  music was way too loud but they do have tons of beers on tap (including a couple ciders) and an ok assortment of bottled liquor.

service was pretty alright too.  it was just one bartendress and she was decently attentive considering the number of people there.
author: spiff e.

description: Trivia is pretty fun. Drink specials = good. One complaint: chicken wings at a bar are usually tangy and mildly spicy... these were teriyaki??!!
author: G Z.

description: The LEAST bitter place to end up after work, with good drinks and great atmosphere to catch up with friends i've been coming for a long time and will continue to come here for years to come
author: Frances g.

description: Pretty chill bar (though, the music is (like most bars) too loud). Quiz night was super-fun and well organized....though it did make me feel like a big dummy...luckily a few people at my table were the opposite of big dummies. When you get enough people together, the wealth of useless information you discover is impressive.
author: Lauren T.

description: Not the best bar in the world by a long shot, but functional and typically capable of not only  seating a large group on non-weekend non-triva nights, but also of allowing said large group to talk to each other without shouting.  It was a nice fallback for the rare occassions when 540 was blowing up and I didn't want to deal with the crowd, but I would never go out of my way to go here.
author: Bailey S.

description: A few of my friends enjoy this neighborhood bar. My friend and I both ordered the fish and chips. I took one bite and the fish was frozen inside and it smelled really fowl. A bitter end to a bitter night.
author: Jennifer S.

description: For a Sunday night, it was practically deserted compared to the 540 Club; it's a nice place to converse, drink beer, play pool/darts, and make out.  I can only imagine how packed it must get for Tuesday Trivia nights.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
If you are looking for a cozy Irish pub with great food, good drinks, friendly bar staff and options like lounging by the fireplace, playing pool, darts or talking with your friends on a lazy Sunday afternoon when its a chilly Inner Richmond district day, look no further! The Bitter End is it!

I first fell in love with this pub back in college. Friends and I would show up around 4pm and we usually doubled the number of people in the place. We also would show up here on Sunday afternoons and drink by the fireplace until it was time for some fish and chips. Some of the best conversations of my life happened in those front booths and this was where I had my going away to LA party. 

The crowd is always mixed and sometimes frat-like on Thursday through Saturday night but still a fun place to chill and relax with a cool frosty pint.
author: Lisa C.

description: This is a pretty average bar but I give them plus one extra star for having a great trivia night.
author: Cathy T.

description: The only time I've ever been here, I stole one of their candles.  Across the street from The Dogs Bollix, pub food, cheap drinks, and pool tables and darts.
author: Catherine K.

description: It starts with the name, doesn't it?  That's a good name.  As far as bars go, it's a pretty chill place that gets a bump up for having pool tables, dart boards, and a fireplace.
author: Tim G.

description: Good old neighborhood bar.  Not pretentious, always comfortable and never too crowded.  The jukebox has a good selection and the beer is always cold.  Food is actually pretty legit too!  What more do you want?
author: Louis M.

description:
Pluses: Fun Trivia Night. $5 Jager shot and PBR pint on Thursdays (holla!). 2 pool tables. An upstairs loft area. Pascal, the bartender, rocks.
Minuses: Can draw a douchy, fratty/sorority crowd- especially on weekends. Gets so crowded on weekends you cannot move, let alone get a drink. Bar smells pretty fowl.
author: Jonathan M.

description: I was hungry one day walking down clement street. I was not in the mood for some weird asian restaurant or some foo foo platters of greek nonsense, I wanted some american food. A hamburger, fries, chicken wings. So I went to the bitter end where I ordered a newcastle pitcher on special for $15 and ate beer battered mushrooms and a steak. Food was a little bland but hit the spot just right. After trivia started and my team name won. civil war oh shiites.
author: Pascal C.

description: When I lived in the Outer Richmond, I used to come here all the time, and most of the time I'd wonder why I'm there. The Bitter End to me is like a Travis album: yeah it's fine, it gets the job done, there's nothing offensive to it, but it's ultimately forgettable. But... it is the kind of place where the experience you have is completely based on the people you're with, which means to me that there's nothing imposing or forced about the place. Which is good. Am I rambling? Okay look, this place is fine to drop in for a pint or two, a game of pool, then move on. Great name though.
author: Drew S.

description: This place is great for food, fun and friends.  My friends and I go for Trivia night on Tuesdays...  nothing like reinstating useless knowledge into my long-term memory, and sharing drunken debauchery with close friends!  :)  And it has a great happy hour special!  It's a great dive bar for any occasion.  And the beer is always COLD!!!
author: Sheilah B.

description:
Tim Keane shines as he plays himself in a weekly performance of "How Can Others Impugn My Mother's Vagina" otherwise known as Trivia Night.

Every Tuesday, drunkards, intellectuals, drunk intellectuals and intellectual drunkards converge on this Richmond district landmark to drink to hundreds of thousands of dollars wasted at college.

4 Rounds: Easy; Music; Faces; Hard. Lots of free giveaways, cash prizes, etc. 

The highlights of the bar are the staff. 
Pascal serves stiff drinks with a laugh and a smile.
Jeanne is a doll. She takes care of you and makes you wish it was cougar hunting season.
Jackie keeps her cool whilst carrying trays of tasty eats next to some collar-popping D-bag who is drunkly mumbling trivia into his mic.

Go to the bitter end to get drunk, stay for the assault on Tim's honor.
author: Elias R.

description: Trivia was so hard!! ugh. pitchers were decently cheap, kinda smelled sour though. all around ok.
author: Krystha B.

description: S'all bout the trivia beybee! I love this place and I find the layout to be really nice. I don't frequent bars alone too often but on the rare occasion I have to say this is a pretty cool place. No creep-pervert-greasy guys. I feel really comfortable and the bartenders are super nice.
author: Alia D.

description:
note: my actual vote would be 3.5 stars. though since it's not offered, the rating will default to the lower number. yelp work on those halves- they matter. 

after another softball victory, beer was in order to finalize the feeling. not a fan of one girl's bathroom stall in the entire building. we're not fans of the dancing pee line. [minus 1 star]
i love trivia (though i'm a devotee to mad dog) & happened to be there at the right time for their thursday ritual. short story: you use paddles, shout out your answer when you're picked upon & we won a t-shirt (not one for each of us- just one). [plus 1 star: trivia + winning - prize we all can't share/make use of]
the crowd was festive & drunk- that's my type of bar. [plus 1 star] 
if you aren't looking for an irish bar, a karoke bar or a dive bar & just want some place to get a drink with your buddies &/or strangers in the richmond- try this place out. you might win a tshirt. [plus 1 star for existing in the richmond district]
author: Madhu D.

description: Took a friend from out of town here for dinner. She was super excited at the grilled cheese (see how high maintenance she is??) on the menu, so we knew we picked a winner. My partner and I got burgers, one had to be returned but overall they were really good. Chill vibe, pool table and darts upstairs. Hip Hop/Hair Metal Dance Party, need I say more?
author: Kristin H.

description: Solid pub food, but by no means the best.  I like the upstairs...makes you feel like you are in some old time saloon.  Drinks can be cheap, especially during happy hour.
author: Kapeli M.

description: Absolutely love this place. Great environment, great staff, and really great pub food. The perfect place to come with a few friends and grab some beers, play some pool or darts. And all the customers are friendly as well. You won't run into any snobs here, just people looking to relax and enjoy themselves. The TVs are in great spots and the jukebox has great selections.
author: Connor C.

description: I hate Dave Matthews Band-thats the crowd who goes there, USF kids who like DMB. BUT! its really fun to play trivia here, and its big, and the bar foods not too bad
author: Lauren V.

description:
Food is not to bad, and the drink specials keep me coming back. Place is surprisingly big, when you first enter. Lots of places to sit down with a group of friends and chat or watch a game. Even on a crowded weekend night, service is fast and seating is not to hard to come by. 

Upstairs are the pool tables, were the rowdy crowd is. Usually enjoy coming here on a week night, when the crowd is a bit mellow. Place is fun on a weekend, even if I feel like I made a trip back to my college days. Weekly Pub Night here is a fun thing too!
author: David B.

description: I've only been here once but it probably won't be my last. Very fun dive bar with a lot of early 20s crowd. I think I saw a pool table up stairs. Can't be too sure however. But it was a lot of fun.
author: Robin M.

description:
I've  lived in the UK and am always a little suspicious of "authentic" pubs in the US. Well the Bitter End does it right. We had heard good things about the food, and were not disappointed. 
Had curry chicken over fries - fan-tastic! Lots of curry sauce with quite a spicy kick and that almost medicinal taste you get from a really good mix - tasted just like something you'd get at a Manchester pub. My wife had the fish and chips. Fantastic again: fresh, flaky, none-too-greasy. Our waitress was charming, explaining the menu choices in great detail, and telling us how she was a former customer-turned employee. Very cool and laid back vibe, And yes, they pull very respectable pints of Guinness and Harp-  along with some nice can choices like Boddington's.
A bonus is this is just a few doors down from the salt-water aquarium shop on Clement - one of the most fascinating stores in the city to wander around, imo.
author: David C.

description: This place is a total dive but it's great place to grab a few beers and play pool upstairs. It's a mellow local bar without any pretense.
author: Marie V.

description: Lot's of beer on tap, happy hour and plenty of tables.  Did I mention they  serve mozzarella sticks? I'm sold!  Only drawback?  They never have enough people working and when it's busy, plan on long waits.
author: Ixchel F.

description: Only been here once, but this place made me happy.  Brand new to the city a friend brought me here for a drink on a weeknight, come to think of it The Bitter End was my first SF bar.  Great vibes, good music (I didn't get a chance to take a gander at the jut box, but whoever made selections, made good ones while I was there) a lot of ciders, which is cool and attractive guys, which is cooler.  Thanks Bitter End for taking my SF bar virginity.
author: Sarah R.

description: Great inner richmand pub. Fun on tuesday with the trivia and the crowds are fun. Props to Paschal, one of the best barkeeps in the city. Keep up the good work. excellent to meet ladies and hang out and have a good time and get drunk!!
author: Danny G.

description:
trivia night!

juke box!

dive bar!

but the bartenders kind of suck...

that is all.
author: Ali W.

description: If you're looking for a bar with lots of unambiguously straight dudes, this is your place.  There are usually a lot of dudes in general here, as well as some nice booths and dart boards upstairs.  Not exactly the most happening place in town, but pretty good for the Richmond, and, in my opinion, MUCH better than the 540 Club or the Dog's Bollix (ick).
author: Emma K.

description: I'm not much of a bar person. Sitting around drinking is not high on my list of fun things to do. You will never find me in a "trendy" bar unless a real hottie has dragged me there. I've been to the BE a few times and it is super casual with cool tunes, booths, and a general feeling of unpretension.
author: Colin S.

description: I got to witness trivia night here last nite. After like 3 beers, it gets a bit hazy and clearly my trivia skills need some work. But, overall, seems like a really fun place to hang out, and get completely wasted. I'm sure I'll be back here again at some point.
author: Srinivas R.

description:
I think this bar is a good local neighborhood hangout. Only thing is, I don't live in the Richmond, so I wouldn't plan my evening or anything at the Bitter End.  I just happen to be doing this summer program that is 2 blocks away from here, and it seems to be where everyone goes, so I tried it out. Definitely not swanky or posh in any way, shape, or form, this is a place where you go in flip flops and jeans for sure.  They were playing this "name that song" game kinda bingo-esque the night I went, and it looked like fun, but it was so loud I was shouting to talk to my friend.  I felt weird ordering any sort of girly drink here, so I stuck w/ a beer.  
The only thing that really bugged me was that upstairs where the pool tables are, people were smoking. inside. yeah. that fuckin bugged me real bad. We are in california people, if you wanna smoke, freaking go outside.
All in all, a solid 3 stars. Not amazing, not terrible.
author: Lauren G.

description: Went here for drinks after Burma Superstar and managed to get in before the Saturday night crowd took over.  Pool, darts, and a few drinks made for a good time.  It looked as though it was going to get to meat market status as we left but before then it's a great place to hang out.
author: Jared W.

description: Fun neighborhood bar--fhe few times I've gone, people were nice and it was pretty mellow (quite unpretentious like Colin S. mentioned).  Had $3 Newcastles one night (can't complain about that!), and they have Magner's too (but not on tap).  Good stuff!
author: Joyce L.

description:
quite good burgers actually, and the garlic cheese fries hit the spot with any beer. trivia night is always fun, and there are a couple dart boards and a pool table. 

the scene is chill and young, mostly college kids it seems. luckily it doesnt reek of adolescent attitude - just groups of people doing their group thing.

on an off night, its a great place to hit with a drinking buddy and just bullshit a while - not too dead, and not too loud that you cant have a decent conversation about lima beans and the such.
author: Darrell L.

description: You can't forget the 2nd floor chalk graffitti! What better place to commemorate and then edit your latest relationship. Makes a great stop in a pub crawl. Super bartenders and great drinks.
author: Loli L.

description: Decent selection of beers on tap. Good music, although it was a little too loud at times. They seem to have something for everyone: Food, Trivia, Pool, Darts, Sports on TV, and of course beer...
author: Nicolas H.

description:
(i'm not rating the bar, i'm rating the tuesday night trivia. as far as the bar goes, foodwise, watch out for the fish'n'chips... basically as good as the microwaved variety. drink specials seem pretty cheap though.) 

my god, sooo much fun. i've been to my share of trivia nights at pubs around, and what makes this one so freakin' awesome is that the host is young and fun. and so he gets wasted as the night goes on. so do all the people playing. and the music round is also by volunteers who are young, so it's quite likely you'll listen to some of the same music as them. it's entirely different from stuffier, more serious trivia nights like at the albatross in berkeley. 

AND here's a big secret: if you sit at the bar, the bartender and other people who are there to drink will help you. shhhhhhhhh!
author: lauren a.

description:
Ok, so I only ever go to the Bitter End on Tuesdays for trivia.  I can't judge other nights.  I love trivia night.  Yes, it's packed.  Yes, there are drunk college students who yell out answers.  Yes, it was more fun when Tom hosted.  However, I think Tim does a fine job and the questions are challenging enough.  It helps that my friends and I often do pretty well.  I guess it proves that we have way too much useless information tucked away in our brains.  And who doesn't love singing a loud, off-key rendition of  "Wild Rover"?

I would love to give more stars, but I'm so fed up with the service there that I just can't do it.  There's one waitress, whose name I wish I knew, who is really friendly and patient as she wades her way through the drunk crowd.  However, the dude behind the bar makes steam come out my ears.  Every single time I've gone to the bar to get drinks in the past two years that I've been to the Bitter End I am consistently ignored for an average of about 15 minutes.  And it's not just me.  Other friends have complained as well.  Yeah, I get it, the place is busy.  Get another bartender or something.  And even when the bar isn't packed, I'm still ignored!  He won't even make eye contact with me!  There are times where he's not even serving someone else - he's just putting glasses away - and he still refuses to acknowledge my presence.  What's up with that?  Poor customer service, I say.  It drives me nuts.
author: Christina D.

description: I came here several times, twice for trivia night. It's got its goods and bads. Bads first: real dark, kinda divey, and out in the boondocks that is known as the avenues. Goods: the beers are all right, good prices, they take plastic, the bartender remembers faces and takes care of the regulars, the crowd is usually young and eclectic (pretty much an absence of creepy old desperate men) and the trivia night with its groups of friends give the place a community/neighborhood feel. Oh yeah, and pool tables upstairs for people who play.
author: Clar L.

description: Good trivia night, good selection of beer, and the food is good if you like bar food. All in all a good place to spend an evening with friends.
author: Thomas E.

description: I almost don't want to write a review because it already crowded as is.  Trivia here is amazing.  Good bar food, great drink specials.  Love it!
author: Angela S.

description:
I've never bought a drink here, but managed to have one anyway. I vaguely remember my roommate holding a beer while I was drinking it. This place also had proof that I can still spell when drunk. I use the past tense because it was on the wall and in chalk (upstairs on the wall opposite the dart boards). Maybe it's still there. If it is, I'm the one who wrote, "Shiver me timbers!" It was pirate night.

This review probably isn't that helpful since I was drunk and I came here at the end of a pub crawl. Well, I remember it being fun. We made pirate jokes with random people outside. I don't know if that helps.
author: Aileen P.

description: darts area+out of the way of minging usf kids=brilliant. this will be a firm desination since the tank got 86ed from the hearth.
author: aidan m.

description: Fish and Chips with their garlic dipping sauce, it usually comes with the mushroom appetizer. I was in heaven. The fries are great, eat the ones not under the fish first and let the others soak up the grease. The wait staff was friendly and the customers too. I am definitely going back here again.
author: E P.

description: Why i love thee:  1) Church pews for booths. 2) Digging into the shepherds pie with a pint of Guiness while sitting in front of the fireplace on a foggy evening. 3) Happy hour(s) from 4-8pm. 4) Lurvely Irish waitstaff. 6) Boddingtons. 7) It was featured in a musical number sung by a gay asian man & a Hulk Hogan look-alike (among others) in a movie about Colma.
author: Trina D.

description: I've only been to Bitter End a few times and each time I've had fun.  However, it does get PACKED.  Like sardines.  I like how they have the pool tables and dart boards, even though I'm horrible at darts.  All in all, it's a pretty cool place.  Good music.  I heard that there's a trivia night but I haven't gone to one yet.  One of these days I will go back for that.
author: Jillian J.

description: Just your average, cool bar. The fries & curry weren't to die for, neither was anything else we ordered. Cool place to go and watch a game, and then just chill later. Nice waitress too!
author: Mama C.

description:
A story of sorts:  I sometimes wonder if I'm Leland Palmer.  If you don't know who that is, stop reading this, go to the video store, and rent Twin Peaks.  But really, one half of me is a nice guy who works hard, tries to maintain some sense of sanity, and is a little too cerebral.  Then there's the other half of me that, for whatever reason, often comes out at the Bitter End.  This other person (we'll call him Bob as an homage to aforementioned show) is a nasty bitch.  He picks fights with everybody (including a particularly nasty brawl with nomadic father), he's seething with anger, and he often yells.  For whatever reason, the Bitter End has brought out Bob more than any other bar in the world.  Which is strange, because this is a great place and I love going there!
Not too long ago I took myself there for a couple of pints.  I sat at a booth by the window for some people watching, and feeling quite calm and peaceful I sipped my beer.  Before I could even say "She's dead, wrapped in plastic!" *another homage*, Bob had come out.  For the second time in my life I bit a pint glass, chewed up the shards, and with a bloody mouth I walked out of there.  The minute I walked out, Bob disappeared.  WTF?!  The Bitter End may actually cause my bitter end, unless I can control Bob.  But it really is a great place despite that it brings out the evil in me a lot of the time.
author: Zev K.

description: Great bar.  Never had a bad night there.  When my fiance (a little more than tipsy) walked behind the bar on Halloween a few years ago to start making drinks for everyone, the bartender smiled and said don't worry.  When my drunken roommate decided last call just meant he should walk across the street and brink back a case of beer for everyone, they kicked us out, but then welcomed us back the very next night.  When every sports bar in the city was packed to the gills with Marina dudes trying to fight me because I wasn't cheering for USC during the Rose bowl, the mellow crowd at Bitter end welcomed my burnt orange ass with open arms, and congratulated me when my team won.  Good people.
author: Benjamin P.

description:
21st birthday party! yeahhh

i think i might have annoyed the door man with all my, "HEY CHECK MY I.D. AGAIN! IM 21!" after awhile he would just look at my hella serious not smiling. ha. whatever.

the bar is cool. has a really good vibe. cool place.

IM GOING FOR TRIVIA TONIGHT!
author: Meegs P.

description: This is one of those places you wish that would make it big. It has a great atmosphere the only thing it lacks is a crowd.
author: Bryan M.

description: I fucking love trivia. It is amazing. I never loved trivia until I discovered trivia night at the Bitter End. Good questions, intriguing music round, cheap drink specials and nice bar food. Sometimes there is an old Irish guy who hangs out by the ATM and gives my group answers. I don't know his name, but he is awesome. Only downfall: can be filled to the brim with douchebags. I sat next to a table of screaming brohans in striped polos and puka shells one evening and it was a miserable experience for all. Other than that, it is a great place to be, in a lovely neighborhood and conveniently located near Green Apple and also a variety of bubble tea establishments.
author: megan r.

description: Tuesday night trivia is alot of fun.  There have GOT to be people in there that prepare all week for it though.  I've never in my life heard of some of the songs they were playing during the music segment, yet somehow people get 100% right.  Don't play to win, just play to have a good time with your friends.  They raffle off free shirts, but don't expect to get one unless you get buddy buddy with Tim.  They have some pretty good beer specials, so I definitely recommend going with that (usually it's Sierra Nevada).  Overall it's a really fun time.  We went last night during Super Tuesday, so it was also a great way to keep on top of things without getting bored watching the results all night.
author: Danielle P.

description:
fun people at trivia night. i wish they plugged their pinball machine in...
i heard that someone stole the plug!? what? i would put some money into a fund to get a new one.
author: Nicole G.

description: I love coming here on Tuesday's for Trivia Night. This used to be a regular haunt for me and my friends. Also one of the few places that i've ever seen with strongbow on tap. AWESOME!!! They have regular bar food (burgers, chicken tenders) and some other things you wouldn't expect to see (meatloaf).All in all, a decent establishment.
author: Lynette R.

description: Historic Irish pub. Very comfortably laid out with booths, bar stools/standing area and an upstairs section with darts and pool (nice old wood everywhere). The Bitter End also serves a good burger and fish and chips. This place reminds me of the things I like about San Francisco that never change.
author: Scott J.

description: this is a great pub for young people.  there's a typical irish bar, and upstairs there's free darts and cheap pool.  There's also pub food there.  The crowd is mixed.  you can find some rockers, some hipsters, partiers, and preppies.
author: Monica L.

description: I miss Boston pubs and the Bitter End is a fair facsimile when I feel the craving set in. What the pub's got going for it is that it's a great place to stop in and have a pint or three, talk with people, maybe grab a bite, or play some pool. It's a casual place with room enough to move and an easy going attitude that makes it easy to enjoy.
author: Stephen W.

description:
Living only a few blocks away, Bitter End is always a great place to end the night. Descent prices, great classic rock music. I've only had great times with friends.

Yes we're the demographic low 20s college students but so be it.

To the guy who complained of the racism, my apologies for all the USF students out there. Honestly, we're not all stuck up rich bitches, and actually most of our landscaping crew are Caucasian. Yes the majority of Able staff are Latino and Asian but they also receive the highest pay out of any of the colleges that Able serves. And that includes Stanford.  Yes there are plenty of rich brats who drive Mercedes and Lamborghini but there are plenty of 'normal' students too who are completely against racism.
author: Natalee B.

description: Trivia Night is the best!  There are always too many people and it's terrible trying to hear the dj/question asker guy, but we usually end up laughing so much that it doesn't really matter.  I love finding out that your friends know way too many pop songs or random medieval history facts.  Def. a good time to be had.
author: Jessica T.

description: Awesome bar, very low-key, great bartenders, friendly, and good bar food.  The Shepherd's pie and Fish and Chips are really tasty.   Guinness and Boddington on tap!
author: Jason R.

description: I did not like this pub quiz.  I didn't like the crowd.  I didn't particularly like the bar.  I was vaguely disappointed in my drink.  On the other hand, I know some people who swear by the pub quiz.  I think I'll stick to other Irish bar pub quizzes though.
author: Heidi P.

description: Love it...came here this past Tuesday for trivia with some friends....so much fun! Pros- cheap beers and good friendly crowd. Con- only womens restroom was upstairs with a long line. Make sure to show up early for a table on Tuesdays. I'll definitely be coming back for more!
author: Kari B.

description: I love this place.  It is the go to place when I want to stay around the neighborhood and have a good time.  Pool, darts and beer.  What more could one ask for?  Food is pretty good too.  Tuesday trivia night is a blast.  If you haven't been, go, go right now!
author: Sarah L.

description: What can I say? I love this place, during the USF days this was my second home. Great drinks, great black pudding for breakfast. The BEST bartenders in SF. Also this was the place where my  wife and I went on our first date... awwww.
author: Seth H.

description: Cool, laid back place for a pint.  Friendly barstaff, fun jukebox and friendly customers.  Gets kinda busy on he weekends but not an overwhelming crush.  Decent bar food too.
author: T D.

description: you know what?  this is a great bar for straight girls.  why? because its a freaking sausage factory.  this seems to be the place where all of the non-hipster straight 'normal' guys have been lurking about, scratching their balls and watching football or whatever the hell it is that they do.  who wudda thunk it?
author: Karen K.

description: Dear Mom,   I just wanted to write you to let you know that I have decided to spend the rest of my life wandering through the Inner Richmond, stumbling into and picking fights with parked cars, and drinking good ole- American beer from Wisconsin. Now that I am seeing doubles on my doubles, I have taken the name of the bar, the Bitter End, to heart and will probably not see you again or at least until I pick my sore bones off the stairs. If you must see the shattered version of myself I have become, buy an inexpensive pint at the bar downstairs and make your way up, if you dare. You will recognize me as the one shaming myself at the pool table, where I have thrown in the use of my uterus as part of the pool, and chain-smoking recklessly since they turn a blind eye to the law about that. But just know that I will always love you and that you did a good job, despite the fact that I may never be sober again.
author: Kimberly V.

description: my girls & i usually start our bi-weekly inner richmond pub crawl here. it's a great neighborhood bar to relax & have a drink with friends. the crowd is friendly, the pool is cheap, the seating is plentiful, & the drinks are strong- order from the red-headed woman, you won't regret it!
author: Lizzy L.

description: a small simple irish pub right across from a few other ones on clement. quieter than the other two, but a good place to kick back with a beer. especially if they're getting to rowdy across the street! :)
author: Michelle I.

description: i've gone back a couple times since my first experience, and the service was a lot better.  the gardenburger is tasty, the nachos are ok and a bit overpriced and i didn't like the salad i had.  lots and lots of beer selection though, and i like the ambiance of the place.
author: Kate W.

description: in need of excercise mentally instead of physically?  then head to the bitter end for the quiz (tuesdays) for a night of entertaining trivia on pop culture and other useless factoids.  the pitchers are dirt cheap so bring the whole fam.  two, three, ten heads are always better than one.
author: rachface -.

description: i enjoy coming here because the drinks are cheap and it's easy to find a place to sit near the bar.  the crowd for the most part is pretty chill aside from some random people who got too drunk.  there are also pool tables and darts upstairs so it's a cool place to go hang out.
author: Molly C.

description: A fine watering hole.  Best in the Richmond.  Radiohead, Pixies, REM, and of course the Pogues on the Dukebox.. An Irish bar but not an Irish crowd, more students..  Really good vibe to this place....
author: Gary J.

description: First impressions, crowded, music was way too loud, selection of alcohol was decent, then i saw the "special" PBR and Jaeger? WTF?? i can see PBR and any whiskey but Jaeger? NO thanks, it took forever to get a drink, and the crowd seemed like as a previous poster put it, High School, yeah i agree on that one one hundred percent, the pour was decent, and after i dropped a fiver for a tip, the bartender suddenly became very interested, he cleaned the swill from in front of us (there had been stacks of dirty glasses napkins and other detrius) and gave us cocktail napkins, hmm OK, so then the large group of what i can only describe as college-jock-valley-dumbF**** began to sing along to the music, I can only handle so much of certain classic rock bands, but NO they had to play them all back to back, that was enough for me, so as we headed out, the bartender stopped us and apologized for the stupidity and the long wait. So maybe i'll come back during the week but absolutely never on the weekend.
author: Cooper M.

description: dear friends, tread carefully at this quiz night. definitely the best quiz night i've ever been to--the questions challenging but answerable, the organization superb, the MC not overly annoying, and completely entertaining. the caveat, then, is not in the daunting task of claiming a table at which to play pub quiz at, it's the fact that your friends will probably rip each other's heads off in the game. on the same team. if any trace of competition is present, and there are 4 or more players, your friendship may not survive. luckily, the drink prices are good so you can shoot all the bad juju away.
author: Shannon V.

description: i happened to wander into this bar while waiting for my table at Burma Super Star (another great eatery) and successfully ruined my appetite for dinner. good beer, great food. it's the typical Irish bar, but there's just something about it. It's nice and cozy - a real neighborhood bar you feel good about going to over and over again. definitely not a bitter end to a great night.
author: Karva S.

description: the lady who was bartending the night i was there didn't even card me. that's rare. i liked the fact that this place had curry sauce for the fries (sort of like kennedy's). however, i don't think the curry sauce was vegetarian. it had chunks in it. hmm. i'd rather not know.
author: Oleya P.

description: Great pub food and great pub feel.  You can sort of feel like you are in a true British pub!
author: Misti L.

description: i went here for there new thursday night trivia thing and we were horrible, but the game was amusing and very friendly.  also, the special ($5 for a pint of pbr and a shot of jager) was pretty good.  its probably the closet thing to a real pub i have been to stateside and i share a love of the stones with the bar.  it loses points because it seemed to get a little chochie as the night went on and its to far and hard to bike to from where i live.
author: Markus B.

description: good club sandwich. bathrooms are a little confusing, though, haha.
author: jeg d.

description: Not sure what happened the last time we went there, but I'll give this place another shot.  Usually, the food is pretty solid (for a bar), but my friend's salad wouldn't exactly be described as 'fresh'.  More importantly, a few of our drinks tasted flat, including my Guiness, which is a tragedy.  Perhaps they needed to just clean their lines, but it's not cool going to watch a football game at a pub and feeling afterwards that you just wasted money on bad beer.
author: Larry M.

description: lack of parking garage left me a bit em-bitter-ed inda end.#2 stops running after 7pm...where da cabbies at? in SOMA?
author: miriam b.

description: I used to go here nearly every Tuesday night for trivia. One of the best trivia nights that I've encountered. Then, I realized that regular people don't usually get drunk playing trivia on Tuesday nights and I stopped going so frequently. Still a great spot to grab a pitcher with some friends, and the food is fine for bar fare. Just don't expect Bobby Flay (or some other chef of equal reputation) in the kitchen.
author: Ben C.

description: trivia nights, a pool table, and a freaking fireplace - i'm sold. the bar staff can either be personable and chat up a storm with you, or leave your group to be if you're interested in catching up with them. standard beer prices, and a fairly decent bathroom too. i love the ambiance and wood decor too - it sort of makes me feel like i'm in a snow resort hotel bar people forgot about.
author: Jenz y.

description: This is a good local beer bar.  Went on a Friday night and it wasn't too crowded but they weren't properly staffed.  We had a server get us beers at the table and then the server ended up behind the bar.  We waited a long time for our bill and then finally I went to the bar and asked for it and they told me they would be right there, finally, we ended up just leaving money on the table.  It is pretty bad when you are asking to pay and they can't even tell you how much you owe.  They are lucky we are honest and paid rather than just walking out.  I would go back but not for the service.
author: Marie N.

description: This is our neighborhood hangout. Great place for a low-key evening and a few beers. Great bartenders, decent crowd. Trivia Night's usually a lot of fun. Definitely worth a look.
author: andrea a.

description: One of the best pints of Guinness in the city (though that's not saying much, as I've found it hard to get one poured right in the States). The upstairs is cool too, with its pool tables and darts. Crowd consists mostly of locals, and the bartenders are pretty cool. Good conversation bar before the crowds on the weekend.
author: Jeremy J.
